item.title: Jiangyou | Protests require severe sanctions after aggression to the lowest
item.description: Hundreds of people have manifested themselves in the Chinese city of Jiangyou to demand more severe punishments from minors involved in aggression to a 14-year-old colleague, in a case filmed and disclosed online that generated widespread indignation on social networks. The protests included posters with the image of the victim, nicknamed Lai, and songs to ask for a "fair investigation." Videos shared on social network X show confrontations with police and punctual arrests. The popular revolt intensified after the announcement by the police authorities that the perpetrators would only be the target of “administrative measures” and sent to a correctional educational center. The decision was made twelve days after the complaint was filed, an excessive interval by many netizens. Before that, a widely shared photograph on the networks showed family members of Lai kneeling before a local official, asking for justice, which further increased social pressure. The aggression, filmed in the vicinity of a teaching establishment, shows Lai to be slapped by at least two colleagues, from nicknames Liu and Peng. In one of the videos, one of the aggressors boast of having been "more than ten times" in a squad without "never being more than twenty minutes." On the same day of aggression, on July 22, Lai went with his father to the police to file a complaint. After a preliminary medical examination, he returned later to make statements. According to the local newspaper The Paper, between July 24 and August 3, the police interrogated all witnesses and requested a forensic report, according to national body damage assessment standards, which recommend examining the victim between one and two weeks after stabilization of the injuries. On 3 August, doctors ruled out hidden fractures and classified the injuries as slight. The next day, the authorities ended the case with the application of administrative sanctions.

item.title: PJ | Three detainees for credit cards
item.description: The Judiciary Police (PJ) announced the detention of three people due to the theft of bank payment card data, which were then used to make online shopping. In total, the authorities estimate that the criminal network has made improper purchases and payments of 1.18 million patacas. According to the contours of the case, in May, September and October last year PJ received reports from two banks on the existence of suspicious transactions in Macao using data from cards issued abroad. In total 2,611 transactions were performed that resulted in a movement of 3.5 million patacas. Transactions involved online payments or use of terminals for credit card purchases. Among these, 771 transactions, which represented 1.18 million patacas are challenged by banks as illegitimate and without permission of card owners. The transactions were made at local shops. However, police investigation concluded that the amounts traded during the dates in question do not make sense in the light of the normal business volume investigated. It was also concluded that the amount of sales is not consistent with the type of products available. Cards whose data were used were issued in the United States, Belarus, France, Indonesia, South Africa, Middle East and Taiwan. The detainees are three residents of Macao, including a 39 -year -old man who owns a car sales stand. Another 34 -year -old man was arrested on his own, and a 38 -year -old woman, a beauty product seller.

item.title: Medical Residences | Registration for 79 vacancies
item.description:
Today open registration for medical residency exams for 33 specialties. Of the 79 vacancies available, 29 will be to form clinical paintings of the Conde de São Januário Hospital and 28 to the Ilhas Hospital. Specialties include cardiology, psychiatry, internal medicine, family medicine and geriatrics
The government officially announced yesterday the opening of the contest to evaluate “medical integrated skills, for admission to the medical residency” of 79 professionals who will reinforce the clinical staff of hospitals in the territory. The parameters of the contest were released yesterday in the official bulletin, in a publication signed by the director of Alvis Lo health services. Registration opens today and interested parties can apply until August 18 to the competition of the liability of the Medical Academy. Qualified candidates admitted to the Residency Program will receive six years of systematic training in the workplace in public, private and community health institutions in Macao, consisting of two years of basic training and four years of advanced training. The 79 vacancies for medical residences will be divided into 33 specialties, including 10 surgeons, but also cardiology, psychiatry, internal medicine, family medicine and geriatrics. Among the nearly eight dozen vacancies, only three are for psychiatry doctors (all for the hospital Conde de São Januário) The two poles Among the vacancies that will open to medical residences, 29 will reinforce the clinical condition of the Conde de São Januário Hospital Center, 28 at the Island Health Care Complex, seven at Kiang Wu Hospital, two in public health at the Disease Prevention and Control Center and 13 in family medicine in the Community Health Care Department. According to a statement published yesterday by health services, the contest for medical residences resulted from the work of the Macao Medical Academy Specialty Council, which took office in March. The body led by Alvis Lo promises that he will continue to develop "access to medical residency in order to prepare the reserve of talents from different specialties and raise the overall level of Macao medical services." The government is also committed to deepening cooperation with training institutions, and optimizing the allocation of training resources and increasing vacancies for more trainees, with the aim of creating a “broader professional development platform for young doctors in Macao”.

item.title: Chikungunya fever | Critical phase of prevention and control
item.description:
With a total of eight cases registered in Macao, two of them local, health services point out that the territory is in the critical phase of prevention and control of chikungunya fever. The subject was approached yesterday on the Macau Forum Morning Program, from the Chinese channel of Radio Macau
In a disease propagated by mosquitoes, prevention is everything. And Macao is currently in the early and critical prevention and control of chikungunya fever prevention and control, the head of the Center for Prevention and Control of Health Services (SS), Chan Choi Wan, said yesterday. The statements were made on the morning program of the Chinese channel of Radio Macau, the Macao Forum. The official said he hoped that the population can apply stagnant water zones cleaning measures in order to avoid the spread of mosquitoes that can cause this disease. These zones can be stagnant water puddles or water spaces with water, having been recommended to wear long clothes to avoid mosquito bites, or even the use of mosquito nets. "Chikungunya fever and dengue fever are transmitted through mosquitoes of ade mosquitoes, not being transmitted diseases among humans. These are transmitted but controllable diseases and whose prevention is possible," he said in the radio program. However, Chan Choi Wan pointed out that, although there is no community transmission, the risk of transmission in Macau remains high due to the importation of cases. Asked about scientific criteria for the establishment of mosquito elimination zones, Chan Choi Wan said that after the epidemiological analysis of each case of infection is performed the elimination of mosquitoes in the risk zone. A circular radius is also calculated taking into account the approximate distance from the mosquito flight. The substitute chief of the Environmental Hygiene Division of the Institute for Municipal Affairs (AMI), Pang Sao Hun, recalled that since July, more mosquito elimination actions have been carried out. "Regarding the hygiene of private places or unoccupied land, if it is verified of an urgent or risk or risk situation for public health, and if we cannot contact the owners, AMI seeks to coordinate to remove stagnant water spaces and waste, in order to avoid the spread of mosquitoes and thus reduce the risk of disease transmission," he said. Light symptoms Macao currently has eight cases of chikungunya fever, of which six are imported and two locations. Public health doctor at the Ieong Chon Kit disease prevention and control center revealed that the two patients relating to local cases are still being treated at the hospital with light symptoms. On Tuesday, the Zhuhai market regulation administration has published a warning of chikungunya fever control in pharmacies, noting that pharmacies need to record data from the users who buy analgesic medications or have symptoms of this fever, or have been chopped by mosquitoes. Authorities also asked pharmacies to disclose information on the prevention and control measures of these two types of fever.

item.title: Kiang Wu Association | Land used for parking was recovered
item.description:
It was to be used as a park of Keang Peng school, but at least since 1996 it was no longer this end. 30 years after, the executive decided to recover the land because he considered that the free concession contract had been violated
The government recovered land that had been freely assigned to the Kiang Wu Hospital Beneficency Association to function as a park of a school. At issue is the fact that the lot has been used as a parking lot, violating the terms established in the concession. The information was released yesterday, through an order signed by the Secretary for Transport and Public Works, Raymond Tam Vai Man. According to the version published in the official bulletin, the land had been granted free of charge on October 23, 1981 to the Macao Most Popular Private Hospital Association. The concession aimed to create a park to complement the facilities of the Kiang Wu Peng Man Luen Hap School. Years later the name of the educational institution was changed to Keang Peng School, which currently still exists and offers primary and secondary school classes in two different campuses. However, the school ceased to work at that place in July 1996, almost 30 years ago, so the terrain was no longer useful for which it had been assigned and was used for car parking. The recovery thus arises following a 147.4 square meter inspection, located on the Macau Peninsula, next to Rua do Barão. "There is the change of purpose of the concession and the end for which the land was granted is not being continued, which is a violation of the duty to use the land in accordance with the purposes assigned in the concession title," was considered by the government. Silently Confronted by the executive with the possibility of losing the granting of the land, the Kiang Wu Hospital Benefice Association, led in recent years by businessman Liu Chak Wan, remained silent: “The concessionaire has not commented, in written hearing, about the meaning of declaring the termination of the concession,” was nominated. Raymond Tam's order also defines that any improvements made on the ground during the concession period go to “the Special Administrative Region of Macao, without any compensation by the Kiang Wu Hospital Beneficency Association”. Despite not having a defense before the order, the document points out that the Kiang Wu Hospital Beneficency Association may try to challenge the decision of the secretary of recovery of the current parking with the Second Instance Court.

item.title: Cooperation | Hong Kong companies for hengqin
item.description:
Hong Kong's chief executive visited Macao and "traded impressions in depth" with Sam Hou Fai to "further reinforce cooperation." The ruler of the mandate reiterated John Lee the importance of Hengqin in the Great Bay project and invited Hong Kong companies to the deepened cooperation zone
An entourage of the Hong Kong government, led by executive head John Lee Ka-Chiu, visited Macao and Hengqin on Tuesday afternoon and had a meeting with a team of representatives of the MSAR executive. According to the Social Communication Office (GCS), Sam Hou Fai and John Lee “exchanged impressions in depthly further reinforcing cooperation between the two regions”, in areas such as tourism, “high quality development of the large bay” and “new opportunities” in Hengqin. The Macao government leader took John Lee and members of his executive on a visit to Hengqin, who identified as an “important platform for Macau's participation in the integrated development of the great bay and the promotion of the proper diversification of the economy”. In this respect, Sam Hou Fai “underlined the participation of more Hong Kong companies” in Hengqin, so as to “grab new opportunities in the second phase of the cooperation zone, to share the benefits of high quality development”. If you say it In separate communications, both governments have pointed out that Hong Kong and Macau are also special administrative regions of China which, over the years, have fully used the unique advantages of "one country, two systems," which the Executive of the MSAR states to have "achieved success in worldly remarkable development." Sam Hou Fai also indicated that Hong Kong and Macau are also central cities of the Great Bay and nuclear engines of regional development. In tourist terms, the ruler of MSA has suggested that the two regions should take advantage of the experience of national games and hold more sporting events together to "attract more and different tourists to visit Hong Kong, Macao and the entire great bay." In this area, Sam Hou Fai argued that the two regions should “continue to reinforce the connectivity of the transport network to provide greater facilities to residents and tourists circulating between the two territories”, and bet on promoting “multi-desert” itineraries.

item.title: Hong Kong | Economic Report Highlights Startup “Historical Record”
item.description:
"Hong Kong's startups are on the rise." This is how the executive in the neighboring region describes the business environment in the region, where they were created in 2024 about 4,700 startups, plus 10 percent of 2023. In the "Report of Hong Kong's Business Environment 2025" it is read that the territory is far from losing economic competitiveness
The Hong Kong government released last July 30 the latest report on the neighboring region's economic scene. And one of the highlights is given to the scenario of growth of entrepreneurship. In the “Report of Hong Kong’s Business Environment 2025” [Hong Kong 2025 Business Environment Report] it is noteworthy that “Startups in Hong Kong are on the rise”, given that last year there were “about 4,700 startups in the city, a historic record and an increase of 10 percent from the previous year”. The document explains that "more than a quarter of these startups has founders from outside Hong Kong," it is companies that operate in a "broad spectrum of sectors, including Fintech [High Technology], Electronic Trade and Information, Informatics and Technology", having hired more than 17,000 people. This number of human resources also represents an increase of seven percent compared to 2023. "All this is proof of Hong Kong's strong appeal for startup entrepreneurs," the authorities highlight. But it is not only startups that record growth, with the report to point out that the current government, led by executive head John Lee, "achieved remarkable results in attracting companies, investments and talents." "For example, in 2024, the number of companies in Hong Kong with headquarters outside the territory increased significantly by about 10 percent, reaching almost 10,000." The “Office for the attraction of strategic companies, created more than two years ago, attracted 84 strategic companies to establish or expand their business in Hong Kong, including companies with market capitalization or valuation of over $ 10 billion, involving cutting -edge technology”, it is added. The report also points out that between January 2023 and the first half of this year, Invest Hong Kong, linked to the Raehk government's direct foreign investment department, "helped over 1300 foreign and continent companies establishing or expanding their business in Hong Kong, bringing investments of over $ 160 billion." Still with regard to Invest Hong Kong, the entity helped "539 companies from the continent or foreign to establish or expand their business in Hong Kong, which represents an annual growth of over 40 percent." At the end of June this year, Hong Kong had 1.5 million local companies, while the total number of companies not registered in Hong Kong reached 15 509. "Both numbers represent historical records," it reads, and for the government of the neighboring territory the data "demonstrate the great confidence that continent and abroad companies have in the future of Hong Kong." Given that Hong Kong also has a talent capture program, the Hong Kong Talent Engage, reads in the report that by June this year "were received about 500,000 candidates in the shelter of various talent admission programs, of which about 330,000 were approved." Of these numbers, Hong Kong actually arrived to work 220,000 qualified frames. Good scholarship scenario Quoted on an official press release, a government spokesman stated that "in a complex and volatile external environment, Hong Kong is undergoing a phase of economic update and transformation, but there are more opportunities than challenges." Given that the territory has always positioned itself as a strong financial market worldwide, this scenario seems to have recorded a recovery in recent years. “This year Hong Kong's financial market performance has been constantly improving. The Hang SENG Index has a 18 percent increase last year and an increase of more than 25 percent this year so far. The average daily business volume in the first half of the year was about $ 240 billion, with an increase of about 120 percent.” Authorities highlight the maintenance of the economic competitiveness of the territory, pointing out that "over the years Hong Kong has been constantly classified as a global leader in economic freedom and competitiveness." Attention to the trade war In conclusion, Raehk's government clarifies that territory seems to maintain economic stability in times of constant commercial conflicts, with Donald Trump threatening and imposing tariffs on a number of countries. “As volatile and turbulent as the world may be, we remain firmly committed to the rules -based multilateral commercial system, with the WTO [World Trade Organization] as a nucleus, while actively participating and supporting regional economic cooperation.” The “numerous advantages of Hong Kong” are referred to, with its “highly internationalized business environment, a flexible and solid financial system, a simple and secure tax regime with low tax rates and a robust and independent legal system”. Porém, no documento é também salientado que a “guerra tarifária provocou uma realocação global de capital”, sendo que Hong Kong quer apostar na atracção de “empresas e capital estrangeiros” para a região. O relatório dá também conta de que “as organizações internacionais e as câmaras de comércio estrangeiras em Hong Kong estão confiantes nas perspectivas futuras” do território, e que para as autoridades “não há motivo para preocupação com alguns sentimentos excessivamente pessimistas”. “Na verdade, o Governo da RAEHK está a criar um novo impulso e a expandir a capacidade para sustentar o crescimento económico de Hong Kong, aumentando assim a sua competitividade geral e alcançando um desenvolvimento de alta qualidade”, é ainda acrescentado. O porta-voz do Executivo estabeleceu ainda um paralelismo entre a boa situação económica e a estabilidade política. "In recent years, the implementation of the National Security Law has restored a stable social environment in Hong Kong. This not only protected the rights and freedoms of the general public, but also made Hong Kong a safe haven to attract international capital and investment," he concluded. O relatório foi apresentado pelo Secretário para as Finanças de Hong Kong, Paul Chan.

item.title: Dirks Theater | NON -VERBAL THEATER WITH LINKS TO SARAMAGO
item.description:
It's called “Echoes in Dreams” and is the new nonverbal play of the local company Dirks Theater. Scheduled for September, this show mixes the compositions of Argentine José Luís Merlin, with body performances inspired by the Psychology and the tale “O Centauro”, by José Saramago
Macao Dirks Theater's theatrical company features, between September 19th and 21st, the show “Echoes in Dreams”, which constitutes a performance in which bodies wanders to the sound of the classic guitar, with sounds of Argentine José Luís Merlin, and expressions of nonverbal theater. The play is presented in the northern zone of the peninsula, namely in the space “Hiukok Laboratory, in number 408 of Rua dos Fishermen, specifically in the industrial building Nam Fong. item.title: HIMALAIAS | At least five dead and 100 missing in a sudden flood
item.description: At least five people have died and more than 100 remain missing in a land allocation caused by torrential rainfall in the Indian state of Uttarakhand in Himalayas, a source of the rescue team announced yesterday. The disaster took place around 1:30 pm on Tuesday in the village of Dharali, in the district of Uttarkashi, when a sudden flood caused a large water drop from the mountains and devastated the village, dragging everything to his passage, including dozens of people. “About 150 people were taken to a safe place.” According to available information, four people have been found dead and more than 100 are missing. We are still awaiting confirmation from the local administration, ”said the Assistant Response Force (NDRF) Assistant Inspector General, Mohsen Shahedi, who sent three teams to the affected area. Hours later, the Press Trust of India State News Agency (PTI) reported the recovery of a fifth body of the rubble in Dharali, while search and rescue efforts continue. Images released by the authorities and the media show the Kheerganga River to suddenly overflow and completely submerge the area, now covered by thick and debris mud, making it difficult to assist authorities. Uttarakhand chief minister Pushkar Singh Dhami arrived at the disaster scene this morning to coordinate the response at the scene. "There are great rescue efforts, involving more than 160 police," said Dhami, adding that food packages have been prepared for distribution and a medical team has been mobilized to deal with the injured. Dharali, a popular summer tourist destination, now remains practically isolated after several access roads have been destroyed or blocked by land allings. Red alert Authorities have asked residents to remain away from rivers due to the risk of new floods. This disaster happens at a time when a red alert was issued by the Meteorological Institute of India due to the risk of “extremely strong” rainfall in various areas of the state in the coming days. Uttarakhand, a mountainous and ecologically fragile region, has recorded uninterrupted rainfall during the current monsoon station and numerous land and flooding. The so -called “cloud explosions”, extremely localized phenomena that cause torrential rain in just a few minutes, are especially dangerous in areas such as Himalayas, where the soil cannot absorb water.

item.title: STD | More than 10 million followers in the 28 accounts
item.description: Last month, the 28 official accounts of the Tourism Services Directorate (STD) exceeded 10 million followers on various social networks. STD also bet on the invitation to digital influencers from the interior of China and Hong Kong to publicize Macau on their platforms through broad broadcasts, images or short videos. Investment in digital influencers promotions, coupled with toy brands campaigns such as pop Mart, focuses on attracting generation Z visitors. item.title: Today Macau
item.description: The Great Barrier of Choir, with 2,300 kilometers long, off the Australian East, has been suffering the largest coral decline since registrations began in 1986, a yesterday report published. The Australian Institute of Marine Sciences, of the government, documented the condition of 124 reefs between August 2024 and May 2025 to determine the widespread coral lanchament in the three sections of the Greater Barrier. The impact is higher in the northern areas (Cape York to Cooktown), with a 24.8 percent decline compared to the 2024, and southern levels (proserpine to gladstone), with 30.6 percent, representing these two values “the largest annual decline in coral cover” in 39 years. In the central region (cooktown to proserpine), the decline recorded is 13.9 percent compared to last year. The last episode of bleaching on site, declared UNESCO's World Heritage Site, has a "high to extreme" prevalence in all three areas, scientists find in the report. “Individual reefs registered a decline of corals of up to 70.8 percent” near Lizard Island in the North Zone, it refers to the study. The death of the corals, manifested by its bleaching, is caused by the impact of water heating - temperatures were recorded one to 2.5 degrees Celsius above average during the southern summer of 2025 - associated with the climate crisis. The large coral barrier “experienced unprecedented levels of thermal stress, resulting in the most extensive and severe bleaching that there is registration to date”, read in the document, in reference to the phenomenon that occurred in 2024 and continued during the first months of this year. The Australian agency warns that the habitat can reach “a point of non -return”, where the choir cannot recover sufficiently quickly between catastrophic events.

item.title: PAULO MAIA AND CARMO
item.description: Zhao Gou (1107-1187), Emperor Gaozong (R.1127-62), lived the difficult time of recreation of the Song dynasty, when in 1127 his members were forced by the Jurchen nomades to abandon the capital Bianjing (current Kaifeng) towards the southern. Of these unsettling times with which the South Song (1127-1279) was started the escape itinerary made them pass through Nanjing, where they went to the current Shangqiu, then Yangzhou until they set a new capital in Linan (current Hangzhou) in 1129. Xiansheng Cilie (1115-1197), the Emperor's wife, or simply Song's Empress Wu who was, like he lover of the brush arts, recalled with bitterness in a brief poem: “Here beautiful plums are early and peach-winged by the wind,/ In the light of dusk, the Jade album in the vicent Celeste./ In Yangzhou I met the soft face of the spring breeze,/ comparing all the flowers, in general, nothing resembles the others. Everything, by the way, would be a little different. In the influence of neo-confutic philosophy, the reform of the society from the bottom up was now sought. Seeing painters' works, there will be a tendency to reduce the size of the paintings, abandoning the great scenarios with the large mountain visually dominating other smaller ones suggesting a order from above, and a closer form of representation emerges from more intimate scenes linked to everyday life. An example of this change is seen in the works of Su Hanchen (1094-1172), a painter of the Imperial Academy, sponsored by Gaozong's father, the inspired Emperor Huizong (1082-1135). In a painting made in a round range (Tuanshan) is a lady sitting in front of a parker in a garden (paint, color and gold on silk, 25.2 x 26.7 cm, at the Museum of Fine Arts of Boston). Seen from her back, her face appears in the mirror she holds in her right hand, stressing the fact that we are admiring a private moment. Su Hanchen would, however, be more recognized by two themes that would become genres within figurative painting. The scenes of children playing, Yingxi Tu, shown in different environments and bucket salespeople, Huolang Tu, transporting a huge paraphernalia of objects, usually cheap articles accessible to all. Both figures capable of provoking an unconstant joy. In two paintings that are at the National Palace Museum in Taipei (one of them, a vertical roller, ink and silk color, 181.5 x 267.3 cm) joins both themes, showing the street vendor welcomed by children from rich families. In a foreboding of what would come next. After all, with a smaller territory, the dynasty resumed in the south by Gaozong would be even more prosperous than in the north.

item.title: CCCM | Fusion with Foundation for Science and Technology creates new agency
item.description:
Operating since 1999, the Macau Scientific and Cultural Center will merge with the Foundation for Science and Technology and the National Innovation Agency, creating a new institution. The practical consequences for the CCCM that aims to promote studies on Macao, China and Asia in Portugal are unknown. The president of the center says it is early to make comments
It is not known whether it will maintain its name, the number of scholarships for studies on China, Macao and Asia, or whether to change staff, but what is certain is that the Macao Scientific and Cultural Center (CCCM) will merge with the Foundation for Science and Technology (FCT) and the National Innovation Agency. Of these three entities will be born the new agency for research and innovation. The process is linked to the desire to reform the Ministry of Education, Science and Technology by the Portuguese government led by Luís Montenegro, and the changes were announced on Thursday. However, there is still no great information about the consequences of this merger to the CCCM. At HM, Carmen Amado Mendes, its president, chose to refer to clarification for the future operation of the center, considering that it is "premature" to give answers about something "that is not yet defined." On Thursday, Minister Fernando Alexandre announced the reform of the Ministry of Education, Science and Innovation with the extinction of several entities, including FCT that has been the main financier of PhD and other research projects in Portugal. The reform of the ministry was approved by the Council of Ministers and, at a press conference at the end of the meeting, Fernando Alexandre justified the restructuring by describing his ministry as an “anacronic structure”, with fragmented organizations, disintegrated information systems and disarticulated governance. With 18 entities and 27 higher leaders between the services of the non -higher education system and higher education, science and innovation, the ministry will have only seven entities and 27 higher leaders, with the integration of extinguished entities into new entities. Regarding the extinction of the FCT, the minister assured that the financing of science will be preserved, with funding for four years that guarantees stability, predictability and “the protection of the financing of the most basic fundamental investigation”. “When we started thinking about this reform, we do it with a vision: to ensure equal opportunities to access quality education,” said Fernando Alexandre, also underlining the reinforcement of the education system. Marcelo can veto The extinction of FCT has generated some less good reactions in Portugal because it fears a reduction in investment in science and research. Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa, president of the Portuguese Republic, said he had “the sensation” that the foundation was replaced “with an agency in which he was integrated, and had other functions beyond those of FCT.” Marcelo acknowledged that the Foundation was a “very old structure” and that “it had many aspects that deserved to be rethought”, but said: “Just seeing what the new agency will do can I answer if this extinction is a good or bad idea.” As for the eventual 'green light' from Belém, Marcelo said that if he thinks this extinction is "good", promulgates the diploma "without anguish." "If you have doubts about a point that is this diploma that is very important I ask the government to rethink. It has happened. I may not veto soon. If the government insists, I can come to veto, if it is until the end of my mandate," he also admitted. A history of the transition The CCCM was born in 1995 during the administration of Vasco Rocha Vieira, the last Portuguese governor of Macao, intending to be “a place of excellence for the dissemination of Macau, its history, its culture and its economy”, reads in the memories of Rocha Vieira, “to all the ports I arrived”. This entity, operating in the Alcântara area, in Lisbon, was inaugurated in November 1999 by the then President of the Republic, Jorge Sampaio, and had as first president Alexandra Costa Gomes. On the CCCM website it is read that the institution is endowed with administrative autonomy and its own heritage, being a public institute integrated in the indirect administration of the state and under the tutelage of the Ministry of Education, Science and Innovation. In the objective booklet, it is read that the CCCM “has as its mission to produce, promote and disseminate knowledge about Macao as a platform between Portugal and the Popular Republic of China, as well as between Europe and Asia”, also presenting itself as “a space dedicated to the study and teaching of Chinese language, culture and history”. The center has also been established as "a center for scientific research and continuous and advanced training on the relations between Portugal and China, as well as between Europe and Asia." After the long presidency of Luís Filipe Barreto, academic at the University of Lisbon, the CCCM began to be chaired, from February 2020, by Carmen Amado Mendes. The leader recently saw her service committee renewed by 2030. A few months after taking office as president, Carmen Amado Mendes presented, on September 18, 2020, the new “Strategic Development Plan of the Macau Scientific and Cultural Center 2020-2030”. Since then, the CCCM has awarded dozens of doctoral scholarships for the studies of Macao, China and Asia, and the “Spring Conferences”, which bring together academic performances around the same themes every year. Also noteworthy that the CCCM opened, in December last year, the “Gallery of Governors”, with 41 paintings of the former Portuguese governors of Macao. A new building that houses the file and library was also inaugurated. This plan sets objectives by 2030, "the reinforcement of scientific and cultural cooperation in the domain of past understanding, present and future trends of relations between Europe and Asia." With regard to archives, it is intended to “modernize and dynamization within a network of documentation centers and international reference file on euro-seatic themes, with emphasis on the various files in Lisbon, but also in Portugal and Europe”. Given that the CCCM houses, in its facilities, the Macao Museum, the board points to the “insertion and appreciation in the museum network at the level of Lisbon and National”. The central idea of the plan was to develop, by 2030, “CCCM facilities as a pole of streamlining scientific, cultural and economic relations between Portugal and China, including the installation of entities such as the Luso-Chinese Chamber of Commerce and Industry, the Erasmus+Youth Entrepreneurs Association, as well as research nuclei in eurical studies”. It remains to be seen if, with the merger, all these initiatives will continue their initial course.

item.title: Tariffs: Seven agreements since Trump arrived at the White House
item.description:
The United States have reached seven bilateral trade agreements since Donald Trump returned to the White House in January and the latest, signed on Sunday with the European Union (EU), is the largest in terms of business volume. In addition to the EU agreement, the US government has agreed new commercial terms with the United Kingdom, China, Vietnam, Japan, Philippines and Indonesia, while negotiations continue with dozens from other countries, US authorities. Here is the data from the list of the seven bilateral trade agreements that Trump was able to obtain since January, when he returned to the White House for a second presidential term. +++ United Kingdom +++ Signed on May 8, it was the first bilateral agreement signed by Trump since the US government announced a new tariff plan. This agreement establishes the reduction of tariffs on British cars from 25% to 10% - up to 100,000 vehicles per year - and the elimination of steel and aluminum tariffs; Reciprocal permissions for export of beef and agricultural products, as well as reduction of non -tariff barriers and simplification of customs procedures. +++ China +++ On June 26, after reciprocal threats of tariffs up to 115%, the United States and China have reached an agreement of principle that is still being developed. Although it keeps high rates-55% for exporting certain Chinese products to the United States-facilitates the export of rare land in China, eliminates mutual retaliation measures and softens controls on Chinese products to the US market. +++ Vietnam +++ The US and Vietnam agreed on July 2 to increase the vietnamese exports to the US to 20% (with a 40% rate on the products suspected of being Chinese origin). Trump's previous threat was to establish tariffs in the 46%.
++ Japan ++ Japan agrees with a 15% rate on all its exports to the United States compared to the 25% rate with which Trump had threatened. The country was committed to investing $ 550 billion (about 470 billion euros) in the US and opening its markets to sectors such as car, rice and agricultural products. ++ Philippines ++ The US now imposing a 19% rate on Philippine products, less a percentage point than the 20% that had threatened, in exchange for the exemption of tariffs on US products that enter the Philippines. The announcement was made on July 22, after the visit of Filipino President Ferdinand Marcos Jr., to the White House. ++ Indonesia ++ On the same date, July 22, and with almost identical content, Trump's agreement with Indonesia establishes 19% rates on exports to the United States and, in parallel, includes aircraft purchase commitments, US agricultural and energy products. ++ European Union ++ On Sunday, July 27, the trade agreement between the United States and the EU was announced, which states that most European exports will be subject to 15% fees - Trump had threatened with 30% - but included tariff exemptions for certain products. In the agreement, the EU is committed to buying $ 750 billion (about 650 billion euros) in the United States, investing $ 600 billion (about 510 billion euros) in the country and increasing its US military equipment purchases.

item.title: Macao Forum | Former advisor to Rocha Vieira enhances complementarity
item.description:
The role of the Macao Forum should be compromised in a complementary way to other existing cooperation. The idea was defended by Tiago Vasconcelos, advisor to Rocha Vieira, at a symposium promoted by the City of Macau. The Major General also agrees with the extent of the forum to Spanish-speaking countries
On Tuesday at the City of Macau (UCM), a symposium centered on cooperation in areas of scientific research and higher education between Macau, China and Portuguese-speaking countries, which served to present various academic projects that are being developed at MSAR. The event was attended by Major-General Tiago Vasconcelos, who was an advisor to General Rocha Vieira in the last years of the Portuguese administration of the territory, and who defended a broader look at the role that the Macao Forum can take. In its presentation, which HM had access, it is read that "the importance of the creation of the Macau Forum cannot be underestimated, both from a symbolic and practical point of view," but "it is necessary to be realistic as to what one can expected from such an organization." Thus, for Tiago Vasconcelos, “the Macao Forum must find its place among other forms of diplomacy”, such as “bilateral relations, in some cases 'strategic partnerships' bilateral, such as Brazil and Portugal”, or “belonging to other forums” or “multilateral organizations such as G20 or BRICS, of which both China and Brazil are members, or the ASEAN Regional Forum, of which Timor-Leste as China are participants. ” It is for the person responsible for a "variable geometry", where "the belongings of countries to various forums simultaneously can offer opportunities for the" Macao Platform "to broaden its scope." And here the former advisor of the last Portuguese governor of Macau highlights the importance of the extent of the MSA platform to Spanish -speaking countries, something that has also been defended by the local executive. Thus, the MSAR can, with the multiplicity of roles and partnerships of the Macao Forum, “reach other Latin-speaking countries, especially Spanish-speaking, given the similarities between Portuguese and Spanish languages, and existing dialogue platforms, such as the Ibero-American conference, which connects Portugal, Spain and most Latin American countries”. In general terms, the official understands that one should “understand the proper role played by the Macau Forum among the various personalized bilateral and multilateral cooperation formats, as well as the lessons learned from the more than 20 years of history of the Forum”. This “is of paramount importance to ensure the proper level of ambition and the effectiveness of any new forms of cooperation in which Macau can act as a useful platform,” he said. A promising land In conclusion, Tiago Vasconcelos said that since the arrival of the early Portuguese to the territory, in the mid -16th century, that "Macao has played a traditional role as a platform between mainland China and the outside world", playing "part of the" Portuguese world "for almost 450 years, naturally integrating its network." Thus, ties with Portuguese -speaking countries are "a legacy of their history," which "helps Macao to preserve some of their distinctive characteristics, but also play a useful role in supporting Chinese diplomacy, further facilitating China's relations with Portuguese -speaking countries." For Tiago Vasconcelos, “Macau's prospects are quite promising to continue to play its traditional and very distinctive role as a connecting platform between China and the Portuguese-speaking countries”, taking into account that it begins half of the 50-year transition period present in the Sino-Portuguese joint statement of 1987. Still in the area of higher education, the Major General pointed out that "despite its dimension, Macau is becoming, if it is no longer, a center of excellence for higher education in China." "Even worldwide, the same can be said about some specific sectors, making Macau a highly attractive destination for very talented students," he added. The official highlighted the role of the four key laboratories of the existing state, namely VLSI (large-scale integrated circuits) analog and mixed signal at the University of Macao (one); The Quality Research Laboratory in Chinese Medicine, between one and the University of Science and Technology of Macao; The Internet of Things Laboratory to Smart Cities, at UM; and also the laboratory for the Lunar and Planetary sciences, of Must. The seminar where Tiago Vasconcelos participated, entitled “Scientific and Technological Cooperation between China and Portuguese -speaking countries”, also attended representatives of the central government's connection office on the Macau forum, among other academic and business personalities. According to a press release on the event sent to HM, José Paulo Esperança, vice-rector of the UCM Faculty of Economics, spoke of the importance of financing academic investigations by the Foundation for Science and Technology (FCT) in Portugal, highlighting “FCT's efforts to promote international cooperation and resolution of common challenges”. IP KUAI PENG, Vice-Rector of UCM and Director of the Institute of Studies of Portuguese Speaking Countries of the same educational institution, argued that Macau “should be based on cooperation with Portuguese-speaking countries”, as well as “actively expanding exchange in various areas with Spanish-speaking countries, building a deep, and sustainable cooperation ecosystem, continuing to expand the circle of international friends and international friends and draw a new plan for modernization ”in the format followed by China. In addition, the official believes that the “remains an important high-level outside opening window for the country” should continue to create “an international cooperation model in areas such as high technology, digital economy and standardization of traditional Chinese medicine, contributing to the construction of a technological power of the country and, at the same time, achieving diverse and moderate economic development”. Think-Tank to Spanish The UCM Vice Rector believes it can be created in Macao “an interregional Think Tank with the best universities in Portuguese and Spanish countries, focusing on areas such as green energy, biomedicine and digital technology, promoting transf by technological means and helping developing countries to overcome digital gap”. Among the participating researchers in the seminar, highlighting Marta Filipa Simões, from the Macao University of Science and Technology, which presented the Sino-Portuguese Cooperation Project in Fungi and Astrobiology Research. The academic suggested “the conduct of various research projects through cooperation between Macau and scientific research institutions in Angola, Brazil, Cape Verde, Mozambique and Portugal, in order to promote interregional scientific innovation”. Already André Antunes, from the University of São José, stressed that, currently, "Macao plays an important role as a point of contact in the network of Portuguese-speaking countries", with a very centered cooperation "in the economic area", although, he defended, "the scientific area will become in a new strong point."

item.title: Hong Kong | Economic Report Highlights Startup “Historical Record”
item.description:
"Hong Kong's startups are on the rise." This is how the executive in the neighboring region describes the business environment in the region, where they were created in 2024 about 4,700 startups, plus 10 percent of 2023. In the "Report of Hong Kong's Business Environment 2025" it is read that the territory is far from losing economic competitiveness
The Hong Kong government released last July 30 the latest report on the neighboring region's economic scene. And one of the highlights is given to the scenario of growth of entrepreneurship. In the “Report of Hong Kong’s Business Environment 2025” [Hong Kong 2025 Business Environment Report] it is noteworthy that “Startups in Hong Kong are on the rise”, given that last year there were “about 4,700 startups in the city, a historic record and an increase of 10 percent from the previous year”. The document explains that "more than a quarter of these startups has founders from outside Hong Kong," it is companies that operate in a "broad spectrum of sectors, including Fintech [High Technology], Electronic Trade and Information, Informatics and Technology", having hired more than 17,000 people. This number of human resources also represents an increase of seven percent compared to 2023. "All this is proof of Hong Kong's strong appeal for startup entrepreneurs," the authorities highlight. But it is not only startups that record growth, with the report to point out that the current government, led by executive head John Lee, "achieved remarkable results in attracting companies, investments and talents." "For example, in 2024, the number of companies in Hong Kong with headquarters outside the territory increased significantly by about 10 percent, reaching almost 10,000." The “Office for the attraction of strategic companies, created more than two years ago, attracted 84 strategic companies to establish or expand their business in Hong Kong, including companies with market capitalization or valuation of over $ 10 billion, involving cutting -edge technology”, it is added. The report also points out that between January 2023 and the first half of this year, Invest Hong Kong, linked to the Raehk government's direct foreign investment department, "helped over 1300 foreign and continent companies establishing or expanding their business in Hong Kong, bringing investments of over $ 160 billion." Still with regard to Invest Hong Kong, the entity helped "539 companies from the continent or foreign to establish or expand their business in Hong Kong, which represents an annual growth of over 40 percent." At the end of June this year, Hong Kong had 1.5 million local companies, while the total number of companies not registered in Hong Kong reached 15 509. "Both numbers represent historical records," it reads, and for the government of the neighboring territory the data "demonstrate the great confidence that continent and abroad companies have in the future of Hong Kong." Given that Hong Kong also has a talent capture program, the Hong Kong Talent Engage, reads in the report that by June this year "were received about 500,000 candidates in the shelter of various talent admission programs, of which about 330,000 were approved." Of these numbers, Hong Kong actually arrived to work 220,000 qualified frames. Good scholarship scenario Quoted on an official press release, a government spokesman stated that "in a complex and volatile external environment, Hong Kong is undergoing a phase of economic update and transformation, but there are more opportunities than challenges." Given that the territory has always positioned itself as a strong financial market worldwide, this scenario seems to have recorded a recovery in recent years. “This year Hong Kong's financial market performance has been constantly improving. The Hang SENG Index has a 18 percent increase last year and an increase of more than 25 percent this year so far. The average daily business volume in the first half of the year was about $ 240 billion, with an increase of about 120 percent.” Authorities highlight the maintenance of the economic competitiveness of the territory, pointing out that "over the years Hong Kong has been constantly classified as a global leader in economic freedom and competitiveness." Attention to the trade war In conclusion, Raehk's government clarifies that territory seems to maintain economic stability in times of constant commercial conflicts, with Donald Trump threatening and imposing tariffs on a number of countries. “As volatile and turbulent as the world may be, we remain firmly committed to the rules -based multilateral commercial system, with the WTO [World Trade Organization] as a nucleus, while actively participating and supporting regional economic cooperation.” The “numerous advantages of Hong Kong” are referred to, with its “highly internationalized business environment, a flexible and solid financial system, a simple and secure tax regime with low tax rates and a robust and independent legal system”. However, in the document it is also stressed that the “tariff war caused a global reallocation of capital”, and Hong Kong wants to bet on the attraction of “foreign companies and capital” to the region. The report also tells that "international organizations and foreign trade chambers in Hong Kong are confident in the future perspectives" of the territory, and that for the authorities "there is no reason to worry about some excessively pessimistic feelings." "In fact, the Raehk government is creating a new momentum and expanding the ability to support Hong Kong's economic growth, thus increasing its overall competitiveness and achieving high quality development," is still added. The executive spokesman also established a parallelism between good economic situation and political stability. "In recent years, the implementation of the National Security Law has restored a stable social environment in Hong Kong. This not only protected the rights and freedoms of the general public, but also made Hong Kong a safe haven to attract international capital and investment," he concluded. The report was presented by the secretary for Hong Kong finances, Paul Chan.

item.title: Rain | HK alerts and more than 80,000 residents of Beijing removed from home
item.description:
China and Hong Kong have faced periods of heavy rainfall in recent days that have forced extra care and residents' travel. In the Chinese capital 82,000 people had to leave their homes, while in Hong Kong streets and a hospital suffered floods and some subway stations were closed
Strong rains continue not to give respite, not only in Macau (see page 7), but in Hong Kong and in the interior of the country. In the case of China, Beijing authorities moved more than 82,000 people from home due to torrential rain, a week after deadly floods that led those responsible for recognizing failures in the response, the official news agency Xinhua said yesterday. Thus, tens of thousands of residents were removed from the most affected areas by rain until 9 pm on Monday, local time, according to the Municipal Flood Response Center. The center warned of the high risk of floods in the districts of Miyun (northwest), Fangshan (southwest), lied (west) and Huairou (north). The Chinese capital kept in force the red alert-the highest-until yesterday morning, before predictions of heavy rain between Monday and the morning of Tuesday. Last week, these same rural districts north of Beijing were the most affected by the weather that caused 44 dead and nine missing, according to official data. Most of the deadly victims were registered in a home of elderly in Miyun. New measures in agriculture The severity of the catastrophe led municipal authorities to recognize “gaps” in the preparation of emergency services. Natural disasters are frequent in China during summer, with some regions subject to torrential rainfall and others to severe droughts. However, the Chinese authorities reinforced the device to respond to the adverse effects of intense rainfall and heat waves on agricultural cultures in various regions of the country, at a crucial time for autumn harvesting. Since the beginning of the rainy season, east and northern China areas have recorded episodes of extreme precipitation, while provinces such as Henan (Center) and Anhui (East) face prolonged periods of drought and high temperatures. This combination of meteorological phenomena represents a challenge for farmers, especially when about two months left to harvest the main autumn cereals, yesterday pointed out the Xinhua official news agency. In the province of Shaanxi (Center), where precipitation recently exceeded 100 millimeters in less than 24 hours, local authorities adopted preventive measures such as channel cleaning and reinforcement of dikes, which allowed much of the cultivated lands. However, Henan agricultural cooperatives affected by drought opted for gout watering systems and localized application of fertilizers to conserve moisture and minimize losses. Authorities have given priority to the rehabilitation of water infrastructure and the dissemination of efficient water management techniques in the absence of precipitation in some areas. The fall campaign represents a fundamental component of China's annual cereal production. In a statement issued yesterday, the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Affairs warned that weather conditions in the coming weeks will be determining and appealed to "all efforts to protect harvesting and strong support for the country's food security." Chinese President Xi Jinping said in 2023 that, although “1,400 million Chinese eat well” currently, “the food issue should not be careless”, stressing that the supply of food “is not an insignificant issue”. China has less than nine percent of the planet's aurable land, although it represents about 18 percent of the world's population. In the last summers, weather disasters have caused significant damage in the country: the 2023 scirred months were marked by flooding in Beijing, which caused more than 30 dead, while by 2022 several extreme and dried heat waves hit the center and east of China. Hong Kong on Alert With regard to the panorama of heavy rains in neighboring territory, they have not given respite either. According to public broadcaster RTHK, some hong Kong stations were closed yesterday due to the risk of flooding, given that the Hong Kong Observatory kept the black signal of storm [Black Rainestorm Warning Signal] until around 17 hours. Winds of about 110 kilometers per hour were recorded in some areas of the territory, and thunderstorms were also registered. The rthk channel also reveals that more than 10,800 lightnings were counted in the territory between midnight and 10 am yesterday, half of them occurred on Lantau Island. Until 11 am yesterday, the authorities responsible for the drainage systems recorded 21 episodes of flooding, and 180 emergency responses were made in 240 different locations. Highlight for the occurrence of an episode at Queen Mary Hospital this Tuesday, namely “on some roads” hospital access in Pok Fu Lam, and patients were displaced by firefighters to Ruttonjee Hospital in the Wanchai area. In some zones of the hospital the water reached the knees, and sand bags were placed to stop the flow of the rains. At about 11 am yesterday this scenario was resolved, with the normal one returning to the Queen Mary Hospital near noon. The rains also led to the large increase in water level in the Lower Shing Mun reservoir in the Shaan area, which led to the notification of nearby housing complexes, such as Mei Lam Estate, May Shing Court, Mei Chung Court and Granville Garden. Despite the heavy rains, some people went to work normally doing alternative routes. This was the case of Mak, a woman who, to the RTHK channel, said she had to make a deviation to get to the office. “I couldn't go straight to there and had to make a longer route. The metro [mtr] made some warnings [about the storm and closing], but I would like them to do them also inside the carriages, because I only realized that access was closed when I arrived on the way out,” he described. The sun Information provided by the Hong Kong Observatory speaks of the passage of an active "southwest monsoon and high altitude disturbances that are bringing heavy rainfall and violent thunderstorms to the southern coast of China and the northern part of the southern China Sea." Yesterday the highest daily precipitation record was broken to August since 1884, when 355.7 millimeters of precipitation at the Observatory's headquarters were registered. For today time should stay unstable in Hong Kong, with “heavy rains at the beginning” of the day. However, these "should gradually decrease" tomorrow, expected "a lot of heat with sunny periods in the next two days." Also the Meteorological and Geophysical Services (SMG) leave a heavy rain alert to this day with “frequent, sometimes intense, thunderstorm”. The sun is expected to start appearing at the MSAR from tomorrow, still with some clouds, extending this weather scenario until next Monday. Temperatures should reach 33 degrees.

The alerts on social networks aim to “sensitize the public for this situation and encourage people with adequate conditions to adopt these cats in the municipal Kennel of Macau. On the Red Note platform there is even the group “A CatStories”, where the stories of cats captured by AMI are shared, and only one publication generated 460 tastes and 160 comments. So far, few people have been written in my story, and I have also left few brands in someone's life. Before leaving the campus maybe this" unnamed "file is only 5kb, recording some shy explorations and a soft desire for human warmth," reads the adoption. The HM questioned one on this subject, given that the animals were being cherished by the students, but until the closing of the edition did not receive an answer. "UMERS" members also question how one can one, "an institution that seeks academic excellence and better classifications in the world rankings, demonstrate such a lack of sensitivity, allowing the capture of these animals without any alternative solution." Aborted association In the same grade it is said that students considered creating an association to “organize the sterilization of campus cats, but the university did not approve the creation of such a student association”. UMERS members enhance “contrast with renowned universities in the interior of China, such as the University of Beijing, where there is a student association dedicated to the care of university campus cats, and at the University of Zhejiang, where UM UM Rector Song Yonghua has previously worked an association to protect university campus animals since 2005”. Regarding animal collection and treatment actions, AMI says that "TNA policies correspond to the guiding principles of the World Animal Health Organization (WOAH), which contribute to reducing the possibility of stray animals being exposed to disease and facing unfavorable environmental factors." Such policies also contribute to the reduction of the number of animals "and their excessive long -term reproduction." It is also noted that "TNA policies still take into account the state of survival and welfare of animals, in order to find adopting families for animals with conditions, dedicating themselves to helping them to obtain permanent and stable proper care." The AMI also says it has "constantly optimized the municipal kennels", and in recent years, "complementary facilities and equipment have been perfected." The numbers are similar to the first two quarters of 2024: the first were caught 266 animals without microchip, followed by 327 animals in the second quarter. In the third and fourth quarters of last year 258 and 203 animals were caught, respectively. Regarding sterilization actions, in the first quarter of this year 289 were made, followed by 211 actions of this kind in the second quarter. item.title: Australia | Great Coral Barrier has been declining since there is a record
item.description: The Great Barrier of Choir, with 2,300 kilometers long, off the Australian East, has been suffering the largest coral decline since registrations began in 1986, a yesterday report published. The Australian Institute of Marine Sciences, of the government, documented the condition of 124 reefs between August 2024 and May 2025 to determine the widespread coral lanchament in the three sections of the Greater Barrier. The impact is higher in the northern areas (Cape York to Cooktown), with a 24.8 percent decline compared to the 2024, and southern levels (proserpine to gladstone), with 30.6 percent, representing these two values “the largest annual decline in coral cover” in 39 years. In the central region (cooktown to proserpine), the decline recorded is 13.9 percent compared to last year. The last episode of bleaching on site, declared UNESCO's World Heritage Site, has a "high to extreme" prevalence in all three areas, scientists find in the report. “Individual reefs registered a decline of corals of up to 70.8 percent” near Lizard Island in the North Zone, it refers to the study. The death of the corals, manifested by its bleaching, is caused by the impact of water heating - temperatures were recorded one to 2.5 degrees Celsius above average during the southern summer of 2025 - associated with the climate crisis. The large coral barrier “experienced unprecedented levels of thermal stress, resulting in the most extensive and severe bleaching that there is registration to date”, read in the document, in reference to the phenomenon that occurred in 2024 and continued during the first months of this year. The Australian agency warns that the habitat can reach “a point of non -return”, where the choir cannot recover sufficiently quickly between catastrophic events.

item.title: Medical Error | Leong Sun IOK suggests revision of the legislation

item.title: Kiang Wu Association | Land used for parking was recovered
item.description:
It was to be used as a park of Keang Peng school, but at least since 1996 it was no longer this end. 30 years after, the executive decided to recover the land because he considered that the free concession contract had been violated
The government recovered land that had been freely assigned to the Kiang Wu Hospital Beneficency Association to function as a park of a school. At issue is the fact that the lot has been used as a parking lot, violating the terms established in the concession. The information was released yesterday, through an order signed by the Secretary for Transport and Public Works, Raymond Tam Vai Man. According to the version published in the official bulletin, the land had been granted free of charge on October 23, 1981 to the Macao Most Popular Private Hospital Association. The concession aimed to create a park to complement the facilities of the Kiang Wu Peng Man Luen Hap School. Years later the name of the educational institution was changed to Keang Peng School, which currently still exists and offers primary and secondary school classes in two different campuses. However, the school ceased to work at that place in July 1996, almost 30 years ago, so the terrain was no longer useful for which it had been assigned and was used for car parking. The recovery thus arises following a 147.4 square meter inspection, located on the Macau Peninsula, next to Rua do Barão. "There is the change of purpose of the concession and the end for which the land was granted is not being continued, which is a violation of the duty to use the land in accordance with the purposes assigned in the concession title," was considered by the government. Silently Confronted by the executive with the possibility of losing the granting of the land, the Kiang Wu Hospital Benefice Association, led in recent years by businessman Liu Chak Wan, remained silent: “The concessionaire has not commented, in written hearing, about the meaning of declaring the termination of the concession,” was nominated. Raymond Tam's order also defines that any improvements made on the ground during the concession period go to “the Special Administrative Region of Macao, without any compensation by the Kiang Wu Hospital Beneficency Association”. Despite not having a defense before the order, the document points out that the Kiang Wu Hospital Beneficency Association may try to challenge the decision of the secretary of recovery of the current parking with the Second Instance Court.

item.title: Most lucrative macao investment where singonese is spoken
item.description: Macao and Hong Kong's investment in the countryside tends to be more profitable when the companies they invest are in the singing zone where Cantonese is spoken. The conclusion is part of a study by the University of Jinan's academic MA Sen, with the title “Cultural Ties, External Direct Investment and Companies Performance: Proof of Investment in China originating in Hong Kong and Macau” published in the Journal of Economics The World Economy. Given the companies in the interior whose capital belongs to more than 50 percent to people or companies from Macau or Hong Kong, the study found that on average companies in the singing zone where Cantonese speaks have profits about seven percent higher than companies with administrative regions in the other interior areas. In analyzing the facts that contribute to this difference, the author indicates that the hypotheses studied point to greater cultural proximity, which is translated into greater effectiveness of business exploitation. The author even denies that the difference is due to any kind of favoritism because there is cultural proximity: “the profitability gain that benefits culturally linked companies is mainly obtained by reducing transaction costs and not through a favoritism -based selection,” was bound. More employees Another of the standards identified by researcher MA without, points out that the companies in Macau and Hong Kong in the interior also have a higher proportion of employees when they are located within the region where singer is spoken. According to the study, companies in Macau and Hong Kong within this region are about 14 percent more jobs than companies outside. This difference is justified with greater cultural proximity and the positive impact on the desire to invest inside by entrepreneurs and companies from Macau and Hong Kong. Cultural connections also have an impact on interest -paid by the companies of Macau and Hong Kong in the interior. According to the study data, companies within the area that speaks Cantonese pay on average 1.5 percent lower than companies with this nature outside this area.

item.title: Cooperation | Hong Kong companies for hengqin

Hong Kong's chief executive visited Macao and "traded impressions in depth" with Sam Hou Fai to "further reinforce cooperation." The ruler of the mandate reiterated John Lee the importance of Hengqin in the Great Bay project and invited Hong Kong companies to the deepened cooperation zone

In tourist terms, the ruler of MSA has suggested that the two regions should take advantage of the experience of national games and hold more sporting events together to "attract more and different tourists to visit Hong Kong, Macao and the entire great bay." In this area, Sam Hou Fai argued that the two regions should “continue to reinforce the connectivity of the transport network to provide greater facilities to residents and tourists circulating between the two territories”, and bet on promoting “multi-desert” itineraries.

item.title: Replicas of voting assemblies for residents to “try to vote”

item.title: Economy | Academic one speaks at the end of contraction
item.description:
Henry Law considers that the economic crisis has come to an end and that gross domestic product should no longer suffer any contraction by the end of the year. At the real estate market, Law believes that good news can arrive if there is a reduction in the interest rate
The Associate Chief of the Department of Finance and Business Economics of the University of Macao (UM), Henry Lei Chun Kwok, considers that the economy of the territory is going through a recovery phase and that the decline of the first three months of the year is outdated. This is how the academic reacted to the growth of gross domestic product (GDP) of 5.1 percent in real terms in the second semester, compared to the same period. Speaking to the newspaper or Mun, Henry Law pointed out that growth is justified mainly with increasing external demand. However, and despite the improvements, the academic warned of the need to track the possible risks for private consumption, investment and the impact of the devaluation of the real estate market. However, in relation to the price of real estate, Henry Lei acknowledged that there are possibilities that next month there are positive news, if the federal US bank chooses to reduce interest rates. Given that Pataca is indexed indirectly to the US dollar, the US interest rate will lead to the most capital available in Macau to invest and buy housing. Henry Lei also explained that a recovery of the real estate market is positive, as indirectly can promote activity in other sectors, such as new loans with banks, new housing remodeling works, and greater private consumption. Better distribution Alongside economic recovery, Henry Law warned the executive to the need to ensure better distribution of economic growth. Currently, law explained, growth gains are concentrated on what the leading industries claimed, as with game dealers. However, law pointed out that greater cooperation between the government, commercial associations and companies, which lead tourists to visit community neighborhoods and generate the growth of other businesses that are not directly linked to the game. For its part, the director of the UM UM Game Industry Institute, Davis Fong, trusts that game's revenues in the second half of the year will be over 20 billion patacas per month. The former deputy recalled that the revenues of the game have always been over 20 billion Patacas in the last three months, so the government should be questioned about what “did well in the last three months” and continue on this path. Regarding the closure of satellite casinos, Davis Fong predicts that the market will absorb the changes gradually. In addition, the academic has devalued the closing of satellite casinos because their weight in the game market has been decreasing in recent years, although recipes are growing. Fong also defended the closure of the satellite casinos indicating that it will contribute to consolidate the position of the dealers, lowering operating costs and increasing profits.

item.title: COP30 - A challenge for Brazil
item.description: The last two conferences of the United Nations Convention in the United Nations Convention on Climate Change took place in 2023 and 2024, respectively in the United Arab Emirates (COP28) and Azerbaijan (COP29), which, as oil producing countries, should not be very interested in energy transition. Now it is up to Brazil to organize CPO30, from November 10 to 25, 2025, in Belém, Pará. This is not the first time this country has been predisposed to organize such a conference. He had already been invited, and accepted the invitation to organize COP25. However, the government headed by Bolsonaro, a convinced negotiation such as his American mentor Donald Trump, "Roi the rope," said it as a said, claiming that the problem of climate change would be just a commercial game. Chile was then tasked with being the new host, but the great disorders that occurred in this country before the scheduled dates, made the conference to Madrid, between December 2 and 13, 2019. It was an opportunity that was lost to project Brazil as one of the leading countries of the fight against climate change. It turns out that Brazil is among the ten largest producers of gross oil and there are those who doubt that the Brazilian government is greatly interested in the energy transition. Undoubtedly, Lula da Silva's governments have taken into consideration, to some extent, the preservation of the Amazon and the well-being of indigenous populations, and have been committed in oil exploration in areas that may affect them. However, the great commercial value of oil makes it often subaltern the fact that fossil fuels are proven to be the main factor in increasing greenhouse gas concentration in the atmosphere and, consequently, global warming. There was even someone1 in Brazil who even said that oil exploration would contribute to funding the energy transition. There is no doubt that COP30 in Belém will contribute to Brazil has an increasingly important role in the context of the problem inherent in climate change. It will be necessary, however, much skill on the part of the Brazilian government to convince the international community about its intentions to the commitment made when the Paris Agreement signed, in which the need to limit global warming up, until the end of the 21st century, to a maximum of 2 ° C, preferably to values less than 1.5 ° C. In this context, the Brazilian official policy seems not to be very coherent, especially since it has already been approved by the House of Representatives and the Senate, the infamous project-Law No. 2159 of 2021, nicknamed “PL of devastation”, because it opens the way to potentially serious ventures to the environment, such as the much discussed “offshore” oil exploration near the Amazon River mouth. This project, also called “equatorial margin”, may, in the face of the risk of oil spill, affect indigenous communities and biodiversity in the vicinity of the exploration zone. In case of such happening, it would not be the first time in Brazil, meeting that, in 2001, a platform operated by Petrobras suffered several explosions, which caused its sinking with about 1,500 tons of gross oil and the death of 11 people. Incidents of this type in ocean facilities where perforation is not rare. Examples can be mentioned recurring strokes in the nineties of the last century in the North Sea on Shell-operated platforms, with serious consequences for the maritime environment. More recently there was a stroke in the Gulf of Mexico in 2010, where the damage of a security valve on a BP platform caused an explosion that caused the death of 8 workers and a stroke of about 780 million liters of oil, causing irreparable damage to maritime fauna. Incidents of this type may also affect ecosystems that mangais are part, causing damage to the transition zones between the coast and the sea, resulting in the destruction of ecosystems and the increase of erosion caused by the associated waves, or not, to storm tides. Aware of these inconvenient potentials, the Brazilian Institute of Environment and Renewable Natural Resources (Ibama), has been denied licenses for oil exploration several times in the vicinity of the mouth of the Amazon River. According to the “PL of devastation”, “special environmental licenses” may occur for projects considered strategic, which, after submission to the entity responsible for licensing and in the absence of response within one year, would automatically be licensed. Considering that Ibama is characterized by staff scarcity, there will be the risk of projects submitted to be approved, after this period. Given that the president can completely or partially veto the project-law, within 15 days after his submission by Congress2, it is now liable for Lula da Silva to take this attitude. There are only a few days to do so, because the deadline will in principle end on August 8. Throughout this process, President Lula da Silva, unlike the minister of the “Environment and Climate Change”, Marina Silva, has shown a certain passivity, which causes some fear about her attitude regarding the promulgation of the decree. According to the most progressive means in Brazil, Lula da Silva should not have been silent after the approval by Congress, but staying firm vetoing the project “PL of devastation” and other potentially disastrous and attentive projects of forests and populations. In case of veto, it needs to be explained by invoking legal or political reasons, such as unconstitutionality or not convenience or opportunity. In the meantime, an international campaign of Avaaz “Brazil: Stop the Devastation Bill” is underway, with about one million supporters.
