item.title: Financial Management II
item.description: Recently, a publication that circulated on the internet in Macao triggered heated debates. The person who published it (we called him Mary) said he was 32 years old, a savings of 2 million patacas and asked Internet users what this value represented exactly. Of course there is no single answer to this question. Some answered it was little, while others said it was too much. But some gave an interesting answer, saying it would have been better if the two million were US dollars. Some netizens pointed out that several students from mainland China lost 9 million RMB in a case of telephone fraud. Others asked him how long he led to gather the 2 million patacas. Before we analyze if 2 million patacas is a small or high amount, let's first realize what savings are. From the point of view of ordinary people, savings are what is left after we deduce expenses to revenues. But those who perceive finances know that this definition is not correct. When we manage our money we must be a certain amount to cover the expenses. Expenses can be divided into two categories: daily expenses and emergency expenses. Daily expenses must be lower than the monthly salary, otherwise the money we receive is not enough. Financial experts usually recommend that we should have an emergency fund of three to six wages. Therefore, if we have a bank account equivalent to six salaries, it means that the amount of one salary is applied to cover monthly expenses and the remaining five salaries will go to the emergency fund. From this point of view, how can the value of six salaries deposited in the bank be considered a savings? The question raised by netizens is very reasonable. How long did Mary get 2 million patacas? If you can save 10,000 patacas per month, it takes 200 months, or about 17 years. In these 17 years, if money is not raised from the account, the result will be achieved. In this calculation, we did not consider the interest generated by the deposit; This is because uncertainty about interest rate is high and the method of calculation without considering them is easier to understand. From this method, we can see that to gather 2 million patacas we must take into account four factors: the amount of monthly savings, the time it reaches the goal, the impossibility of removing money from the account and the fact that the interest is not taken in line. The amount of monthly savings varies according to revenue. The higher the revenue, the greater the savings if the expenses do not change. If the money the person receives only comes from salary, we are facing a single source of revenue. If you provide a property, dividends of actions, or copyright, we are facing revenues of a completely different nature. In these cases, there is first a good, well that then generates a return. Therefore, the more goods you have, the greater the performance and the greater the “ability to generate money”. In the article last week, we mentioned that the average monthly income in Macao is about 20,000 patacas. If half of this amount is used to cover expenses and the other half is applied in savings, 17 years are required to gather 2 million patacas. Quoting Chai Jiu's famous phrase (柴九), the protagonist of the series “Rosy Business” (巾幗梟雄), from Hong Kong TVB, “How many decades have in our lives” (人生有幾多個十年), we can understand that 17 years is not a short period. From the point of view of financial management, it is necessary to save 2 million patacas in ten years. How do you need money to buy houses and actions without initial capital, how can they be used to generate more income? Based on this premise, 2 million patacas should be a goal for several steps. Savings must be the objective of a life that should not be interrupted after achieving a particular goal. After we spend a lot of time saving, we have to be careful not to be slaves to the money or “greedy”; That is, we cannot only save and not spend. Therefore, when we can gather 2 million, we need first to stop, reward ourselves for our effort and self-discipline, spoil ourselves, and then throw ourselves into a next goal of savings. In this life we need to make money and save, but we also need to be happy. Without pleasure, there is no life. The satisfaction of our pleasures requires some money, which will come out of savings. How to compensate for these expenses? The answer is that we should increase sources of performance, ie the greater our “ability to make money”, the more easily we will pay off spending. The income that depends on our work and our abilities is the "money of the people." Income, dividends and copyright are the income obtained through tools that generate money, ie "money that generates money." The more tools that generate money we have, the more income we will have. When income increases and expenses remain equal, savings also increase. Money generates money and looking for pleasure consumes some. Since we know how to find balance, money and happiness are our wealth. People with a rich life experience understand that money and pleasures are just part of our wealth in this world. In addition to them there are also family affections, marital love, friendship social recognition, our health, etc. These are all important elements that constitute our wealth. For our lives to be very rich, all these elements must grow and we cannot focus only on income and savings. Instead of asking if 2 million is too or little, why not gradually join this amount to ensure our health, family affections, love, friendship and other elements that enrich our lives? item.title: Joaquim Surumali helps preserve Timorense cultural heritage
item.description: It is in his workshop in Tasi Tolu, Dili, that Joaquim Surumali preserves the cultural heritage of Timor-Leste by replicating in jewelry, for daily use, pieces used in sacred houses and in traditional ceremonies and dances. In his hands, Kaebauk, an ornament with buffalo horns, which represents the sun, strength, safety, protection and power, traditionally used in the head and on the roofs of sacred houses, gains the form of earrings and pending to be used in a necklace. Already the “Belak”, a bronze disc that symbolizes the moon and is used to the chest and inside the sacred houses, can also be bought in earrings. In Joaquim Sumali's workshop, neither does necklaces, called “Morten”, are normally listed with the orange color, which bring luck and prosperity and push the evil spirits and negative energies. “I want to do this job. My father also worked with jewelry, shaped Belak and Kaebauk since the time of the Portuguese, and so far my brothers and sisters sometimes still make jewelry like Kaebauk and Belak in Dili,” Lusa Joaquim Surumali told. The 34 -year -old jeweler stressed that his art is a family tradition, which continues to this day. “I learned to make jewelry with my father and my brothers. But our work comes from our own blood, from our father and the elders who also made jewelry like the ones that are done today,” explained Joaquim Surumali. Other materials Joaquim Surumali makes the jewelry in gold, silver or bronze, depending on the preference and money of customers. The material, according to the jeweler, is bought in Timor-Leste, but most come from Indonesia or Singapore, because resources in the country are scarce. "As people buy in gold to put in holy houses, it is no longer available. So we try to buy abroad. Most of the time, customers are the ones who bring gold and we only charge for our labor," said the jeweler. Asked about jewelry prices, the craftsman explained that a pure gold "Belak" can cost $ 600 and a $ 100 "death". "Many Timorese buy these jewelry, but also many Portuguese, especially teachers," he said. Joaquim explained that the Portuguese appreciate these pieces because they see in them something unique and traditional of Timor-Leste. The Timorenses buy them to put them in the sacred houses of families and can be seen in all municipalities of the country. The most bought articles are, above all, the “Belak” of gold. About the monthly yield of jewelry production, Joaquim Surumali said it can reach the monthly $ 500, but it depends on the number of customers and visits.

item.title: PJ | Three detainees for credit cards
item.description: The Judiciary Police (PJ) announced the detention of three people due to the theft of bank payment card data, which were then used to make online shopping. In total, the authorities estimate that the criminal network has made improper purchases and payments of 1.18 million patacas. According to the contours of the case, in May, September and October last year PJ received reports from two banks on the existence of suspicious transactions in Macao using data from cards issued abroad. In total 2,611 transactions were performed that resulted in a movement of 3.5 million patacas. Transactions involved online payments or use of terminals for credit card purchases. Among these, 771 transactions, which represented 1.18 million patacas are challenged by banks as illegitimate and without permission of card owners. The transactions were made at local shops. However, police investigation concluded that the amounts traded during the dates in question do not make sense in the light of the normal business volume investigated. It was also concluded that the amount of sales is not consistent with the type of products available. Cards whose data were used were issued in the United States, Belarus, France, Indonesia, South Africa, Middle East and Taiwan. The detainees are three residents of Macao, including a 39 -year -old man who owns a car sales stand. Another 34 -year -old man was arrested on his own, and a 38 -year -old woman, a beauty product seller.

item.title: Medical Residences | Registration for 79 vacancies

The government officially announced yesterday the opening of the contest to evaluate “medical integrated skills, for admission to the medical residency” of 79 professionals who will reinforce the clinical staff of hospitals in the territory. The parameters of the contest were released yesterday in the official bulletin, in a publication signed by the director of Alvis Lo health services. Registration opens today and interested parties can apply until August 18 to the competition of the liability of the Medical Academy. Qualified candidates admitted to the Residency Program will receive six years of systematic training in the workplace in public, private and community health institutions in Macao, consisting of two years of basic training and four years of advanced training. The 79 vacancies for medical residences will be divided into 33 specialties, including 10 surgeons, but also cardiology, psychiatry, internal medicine, family medicine and geriatrics. Among the nearly eight dozen vacancies, only three are for psychiatry doctors (all for the hospital Conde de São Januário) The two poles Among the vacancies that will open to medical residences, 29 will reinforce the clinical condition of the Conde de São Januário Hospital Center, 28 in the Island Health Care Complex, seven at Kiang Wu Hospital, two in public health at the Center for Disease Prevention and Control and 13 in Family Medicine in the Community Health Care Department. According to a statement published yesterday by health services, the contest for medical residences resulted from the work of the Macao Medical Academy Specialty Council, which took office in March. The body led by Alvis Lo promises that he will continue to develop "access to medical residency in order to prepare the reserve of talents from different specialties and raise the overall level of Macao medical services." The government is also committed to deepening cooperation with training institutions, and optimizing the allocation of training resources and increasing vacancies for more trainees, with the aim of creating a “broader professional development platform for young doctors in Macao”.

item.title: Chikungunya fever | Critical phase of prevention and control
item.description:
With a total of eight cases registered in Macao, two of them local, health services point out that the territory is in the critical phase of prevention and control of chikungunya fever. The subject was approached yesterday on the Macau Forum Morning Program, from the Chinese channel of Radio Macau
In a disease propagated by mosquitoes, prevention is everything. And Macao is currently in the early and critical prevention and control of chikungunya fever prevention and control, the head of the Center for Prevention and Control of Health Services (SS), Chan Choi Wan, said yesterday. The statements were made on the morning program of the Chinese channel of Radio Macau, the Macao Forum. The official said he hoped that the population can apply stagnant water zones cleaning measures in order to avoid the spread of mosquitoes that can cause this disease. These zones can be stagnant water puddles or water spaces with water, having been recommended to wear long clothes to avoid mosquito bites, or even the use of mosquito nets. "Chikungunya fever and dengue fever are transmitted through mosquitoes of ade mosquitoes, not being transmitted diseases among humans. These are transmitted but controllable diseases and whose prevention is possible," he said in the radio program. However, Chan Choi Wan pointed out that, although there is no community transmission, the risk of transmission in Macau remains high due to the importation of cases. Asked about scientific criteria for the establishment of mosquito elimination zones, Chan Choi Wan said that after the epidemiological analysis of each case of infection is performed the elimination of mosquitoes in the risk zone. A circular radius is also calculated taking into account the approximate distance from the mosquito flight. The substitute chief of the Environmental Hygiene Division of the Institute for Municipal Affairs (AMI), Pang Sao Hun, recalled that since July, more mosquito elimination actions have been carried out. "Regarding the hygiene of private places or unoccupied land, if it is verified of an urgent or risk or risk situation for public health, and if we cannot contact the owners, AMI seeks to coordinate to remove stagnant water spaces and waste, in order to avoid the spread of mosquitoes and thus reduce the risk of disease transmission," he said. Light symptoms Macao currently has eight cases of chikungunya fever, of which six are imported and two locations. Public health doctor at the Ieong Chon Kit disease prevention and control center revealed that the two patients relating to local cases are still being treated at the hospital with light symptoms. On Tuesday, the Zhuhai market regulation administration has published a warning of chikungunya fever control in pharmacies, noting that pharmacies need to record data from the users who buy analgesic medications or have symptoms of this fever, or have been chopped by mosquitoes. Authorities also asked pharmacies to disclose information on the prevention and control measures of these two types of fever.

item.title: Accident | Player of the football selection among the deadly victims
item.description: The extreme right of Macao's football team, Leon NG Lai Teng, just 20, died on Monday in a car accident, according to the club where he played, Cheng Fung, who expressed regret and condolences. Leong was the fourth deadly victim to be confirmed by the authorities. "On behalf of all players and employees [at Cheng Fung], we would like to express our most sincere condolences to Leon NG Lai Teng's family," the club said on Facebook, manifesting available to do the "best to provide all the assistance and support needed for the family." The accident occurred around 6 am on Monday morning, when a vehicle of five passengers carrying seven people, driven by a 20-year-old, displeased and clashed against concrete barriers on the roadside. The three of the occupants who survived the tragic accident continued hospitalized yesterday, according to police. "As we learned of this tragic news, everyone in the club was taken for infinite sadness and deep regret," Cheng Fung said on social networks.

item.title: SMG | Rain will extend today
item.description:
For the first time, this year, the black sign of heavy rain was issued and it is expected that precipitation will not continue to give respite in this day. Yesterday, the most intense rains registered at Dr. Sun Yat Sen Municipal Park and Coloane Village
Thunderstorms, sweeteners and unstable time. This was the forecast left by the Directorate of Meteorological and Geophysical Services (SMG) for this day, after a morning with intense and quite thunder, which led to the emission of the first black signal of intense rain of the year. “Due to the combined influence of a southwest air stream and high altitude disturbances, time is expected to be unstable between Tuesday and the beginning of Wednesday (August 5-6), with frequent, sometimes intense, thunderstorm,” was explained on the SMG portal. "It is appealed to the population to pay attention to information and weather warnings, adjust their travel properly and pay attention to the possibility of flooding in low areas during heavy rain in a short time," he was added. Yesterday was marked by the most intense rain of the year, which was felt mainly in the morning. In some zones of the territory, the largest water loads felt between 5am and 6 am, especially in the northern part of the city, such as black sand, but rain has extended practically all day. As a consequence of bad weather, and water accumulation, the heaviest rainfall signal, the highest of the scale, was lifted around 8:18 am, with the forecast of floods in the low zones of the territory. This signal is issued when it is expected that in one hour precipitation reaches 80 millimeters of rain, ie the equivalent of 80 liters of water per square meter. Suspended classes The intense rain alert led any secondary school classes to be suspended in the morning, according to a statement from the Directorate of Youth Education and Development Services (DSEDJ). In the same vein, children's, primary and special teachings were suspended throughout the day. The Public Security Police Corps (CPSP) revealed that during the most intense rainy season there was a need to assist a driver whose car suffered a malfunction on the Macao bridge. Around noon and a half, and at a time when the rain signs had been raised, the area to record the highest precipitation accumulation was the coloane village, with 118.6mms of rain from midnight. This zone recorded the largest rain around 8am, when it accumulated almost 60 millimeters of rain. According to SMG data, Dr. Sun Yat Sen Municipal Park, near the doors of the siege, was another one of the most affected places with 118.2 mm of rain. In this place, the most intense rain occurred at 6am. The Monte Fortress (109.2mm), the black sand (104.4mm) and Ka-Hó (104.4mm) were other areas where in 12 hours the accumulated rain exceeded 100 millimeters.

item.title: Heritage | Requested action to the government in building buildings
item.description:
Following the damage caused by Typhoon Whipa, the former Iam Chan Pou Sam counselor understands that the government should take a strong position in the management and maintenance of old buildings or historical interest. The official argues that the Kaiping model is followed in Macau in the Patio do Espinho
The passage of the first typhoon that led to the issuance of Alert Signal 10, Whipa led the honorary president of the Macao population and welfare promotion association, Chan Pou Sam, to warn of the need to change laws and regulations to ensure the integrity of the city's buildings, especially of the oldest and of equity interest. Speaking to the citizen newspaper, the former member of the Advisory Board of the Institute for Municipal Affairs (AMI) gave the damage to facades of buildings, such as the new and luxurious Nova Grand, in the mud, but also the collapse of a wall in an old house in the courtyard of Espinho. The official considers that the government should improve the regulations governing private buildings, clarify the legal status of owners, oblige inspections and reparations of buildings and increase subsidies for the maintenance of buildings and boost a proactive attitude in the defense of the integrity of buildings. Chan Pou Sam states that many owners have an advanced age, are not instruction and do not comprise the laws and regulations on the maintenance of older buildings. The situation is aggravated in buildings where property rights are not clear, and that do not have associations of owners or any organization that deals with the maintenance of the building. As such, the leader considers essential that the executive assumes a more interventional role in defending the integrity of the city's urban park. Thorn According to official data, there are approximately 4,800 buildings in Macao over 30 years old, and more than 3,500 of these buildings are less than seven floors and are located in old neighborhoods. From this last sample, about 1,700 have aged structures, poor -wedy doors and windows, lack of fire protection, pipeline and ancient electric networks and precarious sanitation. In addition to the buildings that constitute a risk to public safety, Chan Pou Sam emphasizes the degradation of the homes of the Patio do Espinho (in the rear of the ruins of São Paulo), a place with a history of over 400 years, which deserves to be preserved for constituting a physical memory of Macao's “roots and soul”. Once the properties and management of real estate remains unchanged, the official thinks that the government should take responsibility for the conservation and revitalization of homes in the Patio do Espinho, following the example of the model adopted in the villages of Kaiping and Diaolou in Jiangmen. It should be noted that Chan Pou Sam has assumed positions of management in associations linked to the Jiangmen community and was the AMI counselor who suggested a public consultation to remove the “colonialist names” from the streets of Macao. At the time, the executive led by Chui Sai On, at the end of his second term, did not access the suggestion.

item.title: Jiangyou | Protests require severe sanctions after aggression to the lowest
item.description: Hundreds of people have manifested themselves in the Chinese city of Jiangyou to demand more severe punishments from minors involved in aggression to a 14-year-old colleague, in a case filmed and disclosed online that generated widespread indignation on social networks. The protests included posters with the image of the victim, nicknamed Lai, and songs to ask for a "fair investigation." Videos shared on social network X show confrontations with police and punctual arrests. The popular revolt intensified after the announcement by the police authorities that the perpetrators would only be the target of “administrative measures” and sent to a correctional educational center. The decision was made twelve days after the complaint was filed, an excessive interval by many netizens. Before that, a widely shared photograph on the networks showed family members of Lai kneeling before a local official, asking for justice, which further increased social pressure. The aggression, filmed in the vicinity of a teaching establishment, shows Lai to be slapped by at least two colleagues, from nicknames Liu and Peng. In one of the videos, one of the aggressors boast of having been "more than ten times" in a squad without "never being more than twenty minutes." On the same day of aggression, on July 22, Lai went with his father to the police to file a complaint. After a preliminary medical examination, he returned later to make statements. According to the local newspaper The Paper, between July 24 and August 3, the police interrogated all witnesses and requested a forensic report, according to national body damage assessment standards, which recommend examining the victim between one and two weeks after the injury stabilization. On 3 August, doctors ruled out hidden fractures and classified the injuries as slight. The next day, the authorities ended the case with the application of administrative sanctions.

item.title: HIMALAIAS | At least five dead and 100 missing in a sudden flood
item.description: At least five people have died and more than 100 remain missing in a land allocation caused by torrential rainfall in the Indian state of Uttarakhand in Himalayas, a source of the rescue team announced yesterday. The disaster took place around 1:30 pm on Tuesday in the village of Dharali, in the district of Uttarkashi, when a sudden flood caused a large water drop from the mountains and devastated the village, dragging everything to his passage, including dozens of people. “About 150 people were taken to a safe place.” According to available information, four people have been found dead and more than 100 are missing. We are still awaiting confirmation from the local administration, ”said the Assistant Response Force (NDRF) Assistant Inspector General, Mohsen Shahedi, who sent three teams to the affected area. Hours later, the Press Trust of India State News Agency (PTI) reported the recovery of a fifth body of the rubble in Dharali, while search and rescue efforts continue. Images released by the authorities and the media show the Kheerganga River to suddenly overflow and completely submerge the area, now covered by thick and debris mud, making it difficult to assist authorities. Uttarakhand chief minister Pushkar Singh Dhami arrived at the disaster scene this morning to coordinate the response at the scene. "There are great rescue efforts, involving more than 160 police," said Dhami, adding that food packages have been prepared for distribution and a medical team has been mobilized to deal with the injured. Dharali, a popular summer tourist destination, now remains practically isolated after several access roads have been destroyed or blocked by land allings. Red alert Authorities have asked residents to remain away from rivers due to the risk of new floods. This disaster happens at a time when a red alert was issued by the Meteorological Institute of India due to the risk of “extremely strong” rainfall in various areas of the state in the coming days. Uttarakhand, a mountainous and ecologically fragile region, has recorded uninterrupted rainfall during the current monsoon station and numerous land and flooding. The so -called “cloud explosions”, extremely localized phenomena that cause torrential rain in just a few minutes, are especially dangerous in areas such as Himalayas, where the soil cannot absorb water.

item.title: Shanghai | Tesla's 'megafábrica' deliveries in the face of competition from Chinese brands
item.description: Tesla MegaFábrica deliveries in Xangai, east of China, decreased in July, resuming the negative trend interrupted in June, at the time totaling eight consecutive months of falls due to competition from local brands, the Chinese press said. According to the Hong Kong South China Morning Post newspaper, which is based on data from the CPCA employer association, the factory - the largest Tesla in the field of world assembly - delivered about 68,000 vehicles to customers in China and abroad, which represents a 5.2 percent drop compared to June and 8.4 percent, in homologous terms. “Premium models are losing appeal among Chinese consumers because they want to save money. They are choosing cheaper and developed electric models in China,” explained Yiyou Auto Service sales manager Tian Maowei. In accumulated of the year, including sales in China and exports, the megafábrica established in the East Chinese megalopolis has delivered more than 432,000 cars, a 13.7 percent drop in homologous terms. The number contrasts with the 35 percent increase of tramful sales in China, to about 7.6 million units, in the first seven months of 2025, according to CPCA data. These two opposing trends made Tesla's market share on the Chinese electric vehicle market dropped from 6.9 percent a year to 3.8 percent. In 2020, when he opened the factory in Shanghai, the quota of the brand led by Elon Musk was 16 percent. Given the competition of local companies such as Xpeng, Leapmotor or Li Auto and a pricing war that led to government intervention, Tesla is trying to recover ground with new more spacious or more autonomy versions of its most successful vehicles, such as Model 3 or Model Y.

item.title: Philippines | Beijing rejects criticism for falling rocket wreckage
item.description: A China rejeitou as críticas das Filipinas pela queda de destroços de um foguetão perto da ilha de Palawan, garantindo que os fragmentos caíram em águas internacionais previamente notificadas, segundo fontes citadas pelo jornal oficial Global Times. The launch took place “according to the mission plan” and the reentry zones were previously notified to neighboring countries “in accordance with international practice”, indicate the sources cited by the newspaper The same sources considered that Manila's statements reveal a "unfair stance" and a deliberate effort to "harm the image of China." The Larga March-12 rocket was launched on Monday from the Commercial Space Center located on Hainan's Chinese Island, with the aim of orbit a group of internet satellites from the company Galaxyspace. On the same day, the Filipine Space Agency warned of the possible drop in non -fuel wreckage in water near Palawan and recommended to the population to inform the authorities in case of sighting. On Tuesday, the National Philippine National Security Counselor, Eduardo Año, classified the launch as a “irresponsible” race that “alarmed the population” and “put the inhabitants at risk” of that island. The conviction of the Filipino Security Council has aggravated the tension between Manila and Beijing, which vie for the sovereignty of various territories in the Southern Sea of China.

item.title: Chikungunya | More combat measures after thousands of infections in China
item.description:
The fight against chikungunya fever in China intensifies with the authorities to resort to all weapons to contain the outbreak that already has 7,000 cases, most in Foshan
An outbreak of the Chikungunya virus in China led authorities to implement strict preventive measures, including use of mosquitoes, drones and disinfectant, with threats of fines and electricity cuts for those who do not eliminate standing waters. More than 7,000 cases were reported until yesterday, concentrated mainly in the industrial city of Foshan. Authorities indicated a slight reduction trend in new contagion. Transmitted by mosquitoes, chikungunya causes fever and joint pain, with symptoms similar to dengue, affecting children, older people, elderly and people with pre-existing diseases. Chinese state television has displayed images of teams to spray disinfectant in streets, residential areas, construction shipyards and other places where transmitting mosquitoes can be reproduced in stagnant waters. In some office buildings, spraying was made before employee entry into a reminiscent approach to restrictive tactics applied during the Covid-19 pandemic. Local authorities threaten to apply fines up to 10,000 yuan and electricity cuts to residents that do not eliminate external containers with water such as bottles or vessels. The United States issued a warning advice to travel to the Chinese province of Guangdong - where Foshan, Dongguan and other industrial centers - as well as countries such as Bolivia, Brazil, and the Indian Ocean nations, also affected by the virus. It's not easy Intense rainfall and high temperatures aggravated the situation in China, where Chikungunya, common in tropical areas, came up with unusual force this year. Since the outbreak of Sars in 2003, China has resorted to coercive measures considered excessive by many countries. In Foshan, those infected are required to stay in the hospital for at least one week. Authorities even imposed two -week home quarantines, however suspended that the virus is not transmitted between humans. According to reports, fish that feed on larvae and even larger mosquitoes have been used to hunt the vectors of the virus. Meetings and defined national protocols were held, in a demonstration of Chinese determination to contain the outbreak and avoid internal and international criticism.

item.title: Hiroshima marks 80 years of the atomic bomb in a context of conflict
item.description: Japan will mark on Wednesday the 80th anniversary of the launch of the atomic bomb over Hiroshima in a context of appeals to abandon nuclear weapons and wars in Ukraine and the Middle East. On August 6, 1945, at 8:15 am, the United States launched an atomic bomb over the city of Hiroshima, killing about 140,000 people. Three days later, an identical bomb hit Nagasaki and killed 74,000 more people, according to France-Presse (AFP) news agency. The two attacks, which precipitated the end of World War II (1939-1945), are the only cases in history in which nuclear weapons were used in war time. Representatives from 120 countries and regions, as well as from the European Union, are expected to attend the ceremony in Hiroshima tomorrow, a record number, according to the authorities of the city of southwest Japan. The main states with nuclear weapons, such as Russia, China and Pakistan, will not be present, while Iran, accused of trying to purchase the bomb, will be represented. Contrary to usual practice, Japan said it did not choose the guests for the ceremony, but notified all countries and regions of the event. "The existence of [politicians] leaders who want to reinforce military power to resolve conflict, including the possession of atomic weapons, makes the establishment of world peace difficult," Hiroshima Chamber of Hiroshi, Kazumi Matsui, said, referring to wars in Ukraine and the Middle East. Matsui invited last month the president of the United States to visit Hiroshima, when Donald Trump compared recent air attacks against Iran to atomic bombing of 1945. "It seems to me that he [Trump] does not quite understand the reality of atomic bombing, which, if used, cost many innocent citizens, friends or enemies, and threaten the survival of humanity," he said at the time. The war continues Hiroshima is currently a prosperous metropolis with 1.2 million inhabitants, but the ruins of a building topped by the metal skeleton of a summit remain in the city center as a recall of the horror of the attack. "It is important that many people gather in this city hit by the atomic bomb because the wars continue" in the world, said Toshiyuki Mimaki, co -president of the Nihon Hidankyo organization, formed by pump survivors and a 2024 Nobel Peace Prize winner. Nihon Hidankyo wants governments to take action to eliminate nuclear weapons, based on the testimonies of the survivors of Hiroshima and Nagasaki, known as 'Hibakusha'. “I want foreign representatives to visit the Memorial Peace Museum and understand what happened” under the atomic cloud in the form of mushroom, Mimaki said. "I believe the global trend to a world without nuclear weapons will continue. The younger generation is working hard to achieve it," said 80 -year -old Kunihiko Sakuma, who was 9 months old in 1945 and was three kilometers from the point of impact. Sakuma, who is expected to meet Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba, after the ceremony, intends to appeal to Tokyo to add to the UN treaty about the prohibition of nuclear weapons, signed in 2017. Tokyo refused to sign the treaty, claiming that the objective is unattainable without the help of states with nuclear weapons.

item.title: Hong Kong | Financial support for 16 foreign activists prohibited
item.description: Sixteen Activists of Hong Kong, resident abroad, were yesterday targeted by sanctions from Hong Kong authorities, including cancellation of passports and banning access to financial support on suspicion of threat to national security. Yesterday's activistivists are part of a group of 19 people, targeted by July warrants, reported the Associated Press news agency. Hong Kong Security Secretary in China, Chris Tang, has banned funds or economic resources to 16 activists, including Victor Ho, Keung Ka-Wai, Australian student Chongyi Feng and US citizen Gong Sasha, according to Hong Kong government statement. The travel documents were canceled to 12 of the 16 Hong Kong passport holders. The Hong Kong government has also banned access to lease to 16 indicted, as well as commercial or business activity, stressing that any violation of orders is subject to a penalty of up to seven years in prison. The 16 activists are out of Hong Kong, and are accused of remaining involved in activities that endanger national security. The accusation also covers incitement to hatred against Beijing and Hong Kong, on the grounds of defamation and slander. The measures now adopted, according to the statement of the Hong Kong authorities, were taken "to have a significant impact."

item.title: China requires greater control of technology in training models with AI algorithms
item.description: Chinese authorities warned yesterday with the risks associated with the so -called “data contamination” in Artificial Intelligence Systems (AI) and instituted technology companies to reinforce the control of the information used in the training of their models. In a statement published on the Wechat social network, the State Ministry of Security warned that the proliferation of texts, images and videos generated by IA is increasing the likelihood of “falsified, skewed or repetitive” contents to integrate new training data sets, which may result in judgment errors, “wrong automatic decisions” or “public opinion handling”. Authorities cite studies that one in 10,000 samples would be false to make the number of harmful responses from a model to increase in a significant way. This “waterfall effect”, where artificially generated contents generated new systems, is a matter of concern for sensitive sectors such as health, finance or public safety, where decisions based on inaccurate data would have a direct impact on the population. To mitigate these risks, the ministry has recalled that since January, a regulation that obliges the Generative AI platforms to perform security audits, clearly identify the contents produced by artificial intelligence, and periodically eliminate data that violates the rules in force. The body had already warned, in July, that the use of AI could represent a threat to “social stability”, sensitive data protection and national security if technology falls into the hands of “hostile forces to China”. General distrust Since 2023, AI services in the country have been obliged to follow the “fundamental socialist values” and prohibited from “generating content that undermines national security, territorial unity and social stability”. Despite the launch of chatbots by large Chinese technological groups such as Alibaba, Deepseek, Tencent or Bytedance, doubts about AI development persist. Since 2023, the State Ministry of Security has published regularly in its official accounting account of alleged spying and recommends to the population to be suspicious of job offers or requests for information from abroad. At the same time, the ministry calls for a “mobilization of the whole society” to “prevent and combat espionage” and “reinforce national defense”, warning of the risks of sending sensitive data over the internet.

item.title: Tariffs | Beijing opens market to Brazilian coffee in response to US rates
item.description:
The tariff war imposed by the US administration continues to lead to the adoption of against measures. Given the imposition of 50% rates on Brazil for political reasons, China opens the doors to Brazilian coffee
China has authorized 183 Brazilian companies to export coffee to its domestic market, yesterday advanced local press, days after the United States imposed 50 percent rates on coffee from Brazil. The measure, valid for five years, was released a few days after the announcement of the new US tariff, which comes into force tomorrow, and caused alarm among Brazilian producers and exporters, now forced to look for alternative markets. According to industry data, about 85 percent of Brazilian Arabica production in 2025 - the most exported variety for the US - has already been harvested. This type of coffee plays a central role in the US market, where it is often mixed with softer grains from other Latin American producers to suit the local taste. Brazil is responsible for 44 percent of world arabica production, which makes the country a difficult to replace in the short term. The United States is the largest consumer of coffee and imported 3.3 million Brazilian coffee bags in the first half of the year, almost 23 percent of the total exported by Brazil during this period. Already China imported 530 thousand bags in the same interval. Although the Chinese market is even smaller, it has been gaining importance as Brazilian access to the US market faces new barriers. Last November, Apexbrasil, the Brazilian Export Promotion Agency, signed an agreement with Luckin Coffee, China's largest coffee chain, to supply 240,000 tons of Brazilian coffee between 2025 and 2029. The contract is valued at $ 2.5 billion and succeeds a previous agreement of mid -2024, worth $ tons. Growing Founded in 2017, Luckin Coffee currently operates over 22,000 stores throughout the Chinese territory and serves over 300 million customers. Although tea remains the dominant traditional drink, coffee consumption has been growing rapidly in the Asian country, especially among young urban professionals. The per capita consumption doubled in five years, from eight to 16 cups a year - still well below the global average of 240 cups and more than 400 registered in the US. At the time of the agreement, Luckin Coffee executive director Jinyi Guo praised Brazilian coffee and described the contract as “the beginning” of a long -term collaboration. "In the future, we want to further expand this partnership," he said. Since 2009, China is the main commercial partner in Brazil, with bilateral trade from nine billion dollars in 2004 to 188 billion in 2024. Brazil plays, in particular, an important role in China's food security, composing more than 20 percent of the Asian's agricultural and livestock imports. The second world's second largest economy feeds nearly 19 percent of humanity with only 8.5 percent of the planet's arable lands. By comparison, the Latin American country has almost 7 percent of the arable land to 2.7 percent of the world's population.

item.title: Anabela Santiago, Academic: “China is a reformist and moderate”
item.description:
Anabela Santiago has just defended at the University of Aveiro the doctoral thesis that analyzes how China has been positioned in recent decades as an important actor in the “global health governance”. Today, Beijing seeks “alternative mechanisms” of cooperation in the “global south” and tries to build an alternative model to the World Health Organization
Let's start with the concept of Global Health Governance (GGS). Is this a more contemporary concept or relating to the post-war period and the Foundation of the World Health Organization (WHO)? What have been the main actors of this governance until China's growth? GGS is a concept whose prominence and relevance have grown significantly in the 21st century, largely driven by economic globalization and worldwide interconnection. Although global health has always transcended national borders, demanding multidisciplinary approaches and international cooperation, only from the 1990s it was made greater awareness of it. Historically, GGS has been predominantly influenced by western powers and neoliberal values. The main actors of this governance, until China's growth, were historically marked by interventions of entities such as WHO and non-governmental, predominantly American and European organizations. One of the findings of its doctoral thesis is that China has been progressively positioning itself in this leadership. This position started specifically when and why? Yes, China has been progressively positioned as a relief actor in the evolution of the GG system. Although it is not possible to point out an exact start date, China has evolved from a relatively isolated country to a main actor in global political, economic and technological arenas. Its growing economic and political influence also represents a change in GGS's historical dynamics, and in the 1960s China tried to play a humanitarian health care role in neighboring countries and Africa. The thesis points out that China's experience can be seen as an example of what is achievable when a state chooses its own way rather than a pre-established model, aligning itself with the 21st century prediction as the "century of Asia." Did the pandemic years influence this position? How? Covid-19 pandemic highlighted the need for global health cooperation, as well as the potential consequences of the failure to prioritize global health. The thesis explores the evolution of the Health Silk Route before and after the pandemic, indicating that the pandemic years allowed greater awareness of the need for instruments such as the Health Silk Route as the most effective cooperation platforms among nations. Although not detailed in this specific section, it is implicit that the pandemic intensified China's performance in health diplomacy and health development assistance. Looking at the internal reforms that China has carried out in the health area, which highlights as the most important? I approach, in the thesis, the reforms of the China Health System and I point out that the Chinese governance model is a unique combination of state -oriented economic reforms and development by the state, incorporating elements of neoliberalism and authoritarianism into political issues in general, and the health sector is nothing different from the rest. One of China's mentioned contributions, recognized by WHO, is its primary health care model based on the recognized good practice of “barefoot doctors” (barefoot doctors). In addition, the thesis analyzes the main reform policies and their progress and challenges in the period 2009-2018, which comprise the reforms of primary health care, hospital and pharmaceutical reform. The “Healthy China 2030” program is also an important and ambitious reference of China's domestic reforms in health, also encompassing social determinants. Is Beijing's intention to create an alternative entity to WHO, or simply create an alternative movement that can coexist with WHO, in the context of the relationship with the global south? How could this work? The thesis suggests that China adopts a "dual approach": while integrating in existing global structures, forging simultaneously alternative paths, particularly through regional alliances such as BRICS and partnerships with Global South. This indicates an intention to create an alternative movement that can coexist and complement the role of WHO, rather than a direct alternative entity. China demonstrates a clear commitment to align the objectives of the “Belt and Road” initiative with the united nations sustainable development objectives, showing their willingness to present these initiatives as complements to the existing cooperation mechanisms in the international liberal order. President Xi Jinping's view of a “future community shared for humanity”, which includes the notion of a “global health community for all”, also points to a new perspective in international cooperation. Traditional Chinese Masks, Vaccines and Medicine (MTC): What are China's products or instruments to position itself as an increasingly global actor in GGS? The thesis points out that China is an indispensable provider of global public health, essential for the product supply chain, such as masks and vaccines. The MTC is also mentioned as one of China's great contributions to global health governance, with its chinese herbal treatments, some of which already recognized by WHO in 2017. In addition, Chinese medical assistance and medical teams sent to other regions of the globe are important instruments of Chinese health diplomacy. In creating an alternative movement or reality to WHO, China may be taking advantage of the lack of full representativeness in the same WHO, or gaps in its operation? The thesis does not address directly whether China is taking advantage of a lack of full representativeness in WHO or gaps in its operation. However, it emphasizes that the work aims to fill a gap in scientific knowledge in relation to the paradigm of health governance from a non-western and liberal perspective, emphasizing China as an actor of the global south. This suggests that China seeks to strengthen alternative models that can offer more personalized health challenges, different from those defended by Western countries, positioning itself as a moderate reformist actor. How has the European Union (EU) foreign policy in relation to China affecting or influenced this position of the country in global health governance? In the thesis, the fourth publication, entitled "Challenges on the European Union-China Cooperation in Higher Education from" People-To-People Dialogue ’Perspective: The Case of Health-Related Joint Projects," explores cooperation in higher education, in particular that includes health-related projects. Therefore, despite the strategic and economic dialogue, the deterioration of UE-china bilateral relations intensified, with the commission to assume a decline of enthusiasm due to “China's countermeasures to EU human rights sanctions, economic coercion and commercial measures against the single market, and the positioning of China in the war in Ukraine”. Although challenges and tensions are recognized, cooperation in higher education, including health projects, is seen as part of a broader picture of strategic partnership between EU and China. However, it is evident that there is no long tradition of health cooperation between EU and China in higher education, and that there are few joint projects compared to the general panorama. It is suggested that both EU and China should make more efforts to align medical study curricula and promote more joint research in areas related to health, infectious diseases, among others. In the Trump 2.0 era, and without pandemic, what could be China's role in global health governance? Although the thesis is published this year, it focuses on the preceding period and includes the pandemic, where it does not speculate directly on a future scenario of “Trump 2.0” without pandemic. However, the thesis argues that China is not just a participant, but a moderate reformist force in the formation of global health standards. Regardless of future political scenarios, their growing economic and political influence, strategic health diplomacy, internal reforms and initiatives such as the Health Silk Route will continue to shape their role in global health governance. The view of a “global health community for all” also remains a guiding principle for China's efforts. Does this power of China in GGS verify more with bilateral or multilateral agreements? The thesis suggests that China's power in global health governance manifests itself through both bilateral and multilateral agreements, but with a growing emphasis on certain forms of cooperation that strengthen their role in the global south and through alternative mechanisms. Although the thesis does not explicitly quantify the predominance between bilateral and multilateral, the focus on regional alliances (BRICS) and partnerships with the Global South (which often involve bilateral agreements and group cooperation initiatives) and the Health Silk Route indicate a hybrid approach.

item.title: Macao Forum | Secretary-General says it has never discussed widening to Hispanic countries
item.description:
In an interview with Lusa agency, the secretary general of the Macau Forum, Ji Xianzheng, assured that “never discussed” the widening of action to Hispanic countries, but that to realize the will already stated by the government of Sam Hou Fai will have to be the authorities to decide a new direction to the cooperation strategy
The Secretary-General of the Macau Forum stated that the institution “never discussed” the creation of an entity to extend to Hispanic countries to promote economic cooperation similar to those that provide the connection between China and Portuguese-speaking countries. “Within the Macao Forum, we have never discussed this topic,” said the Forum Secretary-General for Economic and Commercial Cooperation between China and Portuguese-speaking countries Ji Xianzheng. The official acknowledged that, "in society, there were some conversations to discuss or address the possibility of promoting more contact and cooperation with Spanish -language countries, but at the Forum level we have never addressed this theme." The Macao executive announced in mid -April the intention of creating a center to promote economic services between China and the Portuguese and Spanish languages in the neighboring special Economic Zone of Hengqin. The idea is to provide companies in Hispanic countries services in the “linguistic, legal, fiscal, verification of compliance with norms, formation, arbitration and mediation”, according to the Secretary for Administration and Justice, André Cheong. Days earlier, the chief executive, Sam Hou Fai, had also announced the intention of “promoting exchange and cooperation” through Macao between China and the universe of Spanish -speaking countries. Although Macau wants to widen focus to Castilian -speaking countries, “the forum will remain the forum for China and Lusophony countries,” said Ji Xianzheng. The secretary general clarified that the institution that directs "can contribute contributions to the greater opening of Macao in international cooperation", as is the intention announced by the new government of MSAR. Complementary forum Personally, the secretary general has ensured that he had “pleasing to work with all parties,” but stressed that this is a “decision that is up to central governments to make” and that the forum was never contacted in this regard. "Yes, I worked in Latin America, Spain, nine years in Madrid and Caracas. But this is not a decision of personal interest, it is up to politicians to make the decision," he said, explaining that the idea will be to promote the relationship between Macao and Brazil and then to other Latin American countries, as well as expanding the relationship with Portugal to Spain. "There is no limit. The Macao Forum is complementary. It does not restrict any promotion of the cooperation of the other parts," he said. According to the Macao Government Communication Office, Sam Hou Fai admitted on June 21 that he postponed a trip to Portugal, scheduled for July, and should also pass through Spain and the European Union headquarters in Brussels. Bad interpretations In the same interview with Lusa, the secretary general of the Macao Forum imputed to national governments the responsibility for conducting economic development and cooperation policies, stressing that the institution “has no investment projects”. Ji Xianzheng attributes criticism to the Macao Forum to an wrong interpretation regarding the body's mission. "The forum is a mechanism of cooperation between central governments. Many people think it is to the secretariat that it is up to the execution of policies, but we have a limited number of people," added Ji. "The secretariat has no investment projects, is a mechanism for preparing the ministerial conference, connecting with governments, is not a promotion agency. It has not been thought of, connects with the promotion agencies. We are four people sent by China and one delegate for each country," he said. At the last ministerial conference, in April 2024, then Portuguese Economy Minister Pedro Reis argued that the Portuguese Language China-Parais Cooperation and Development Fund should bet more on small and medium enterprises (SMEs). The Cooperation Fund was created in 2013 by the China Development Bank and the Macao Industrial and Commercial Development Fund, with a thousand million dollars, of which about 60 percent have already been invested, according to the secretary general. Action plans Ji Xianzheng has admitted that SMEs are "a difficult theme for any government" and that "international cooperation for the promotion of development and cooperation of small and medium enterprises is even more difficult. It is a topic that is being debated daily worldwide." But admitted, "here, little." "But it is stipulated in the action plan [2024-2026]. It is up to central governments and commerce chambers, promotion agents, to work together to do this. The secretariat assumes responsibility as authorized by the central governments, specifically, in the activities program," he said. Politicians from various countries, including Portugal, Angola and Mozambique, have appealed to a change in the rules of the fund's candidacy. Current rules require, for example, that candidate projects have a minimum investment of five million dollars, and the fund only covers 20 percent of total investment, referring the rest to governments or companies. Ji Xianzheng said the new fund's new direction "is committed to promoting a broader investment, with better coverage for all forum countries, [relatively] to projects that have a strategic or significant impact on the socioeconomic development of participating countries." According to the secretary general, "the terms of application [of the rules of access to the background] will be more flexible and the forms of application will also be more diverse." “Instead of being just direct investment, they are also studying ways to apply the fund, in cooperation with other funds or with other financial institutions,” he gave as an example. "This fund has an operation according to market rules. It is not a humanitarian aid fund. Therefore, it has to guarantee the minimum return of benefit. But, on that, they are very open to study, in this case, the conditions of each project," added Ji Xianzheng, but to give examples of "flexibilization of the rules." Regarding the approximation of the China universe and countries of the Iberian Peninsula, already cemented in official speeches, economist Maria Fernanda Ilhéu, president of the Seda's New Route Association, told HM, earlier this month, that this intention is “very objective and pragmatic and can be summarized to the Macao economy diversification project, for which companies and investors are not only in Macao, but also from Macao, but also from Macao, but also from countries, but countries Portuguese Language ”. "But the fact is that companies and institutions from Portuguese-speaking countries are not being effective in responding to this need for Macao. Therefore, widening companies and Spanish institutions this invitation to cooperation seems logical to me," the economist said.

item.title: Filipe de Saavedra, Teacher: “A Camões Interpretative Center in Macau is missing”
item.description:
Professor at the University of Science and Technology of Macao and a scholar of the presence of Camões in Asia, Philip de Saavedra understands that Macau is missing an interpretative center about the poet's life and work. The academic spoke yesterday at the National Library in Lisbon, about the correspondence written by Luís de Camões in Asia
He participated yesterday at the “from Lisbon to Goa: What the Letters of Camões” participated. What path does the East arise portrayed in these letters, and who were directed? The letters Camões wrote from Asia are in the order of the dozens. There is in them scholarship, philosophy, and also a lot of humor, sarcasm, and satire of humanist nature. Some were written from Ternate, others from Malaca, Macau, probably others from Cambodia, to recipients in India and Portugal. With the exception of the letters of Goa, where the identification of the writing site is generally present, maping those that were written during the rest of it would be a complex task. They are only given as written in Asia. Can you give examples of written letters in this context? I mention here two of the first he sent to the kingdom. The epistle whose first line is “The Poet Simony speaking” was written in January 1554, when Camões has just arrived in Goa, destined for his pupil, D. António de Noronha. It is a very emotional letter, giving it the storm that had plagued the Armada in the Cape of Good Hope, "seeing the death of the before me." Camões survived this limit experience aboard the São Bento ship, the only one to arrive that year to Goa, and which was lost in the turn of the Christmas lands, dying in this second bid the Captain Fernão de Álvares Cabral, and many of those who traveled with him. In addition to the news of his salvation, the poet was equally eager to tell his friend the expedition of D. Afonso de Noronha to Malabar, in which he had taken part in the previous month. In Irenal pages, Camões vehemently condemns the massacre of the few native troops by the “thick armed” of the disproportionate vice-king army. In his radical compliment of peace, the poet calls "true remedy" to the early death that cure the war crazes of those who want to live "by knights", for "who will walk by following the fero Mars always brings their eyes to their danger." Cruelly prophetic words: by irony of fate, at the moment the poet wrote these lines and sent them, that recipient diletus, for whose life he feared, already lay, lying during a military foray in Ceuta on April 29, 1553, only 17 years old. And the second letter? A year later, in January 1555, he wrote to a friend a different epistle in tone and in purpose, whose first line is "I wished so much", where he evoked the shock he suffered from the death of D. António, gathering a sonnet that had composed to his memory. It is clear that Camões also had great intimacy with this correspondent, who knew D. António and the poetry of Camões, Petrarch and Boscán. Interestingly, the letter includes some male lines, which Camões says they are mandatory in private letters, containing what can be called a resort conversation, so being worship or scholar did not prevent it if it were "bon vivant". The presence of Camões in Macau is still wrapped in a certain myth. What are the concrete tests of your presence in the territory? It is necessary to separate the waters. The landing of Camões in Patane's busty, then called “cave”, is surrounded by a beautiful legendary aura. But the presence of Camões in Macao, this is not involved in "myth", is a factual and historical reality, founded on a wide variety of testimonies, all independent of each other. Insisting on a chronology that contained in the sources, but which was flagrantly erroneous, it was deliberately sought to confuse the doubts that could have about his permanence in the sinned, although unjustified, with false doubts about the poet's stay in Macau, which are laughable and devoid of the minimum foundation. The joke ran a swimming, and little by little it was embedded in the collective imagination, to the point that some less informed people take it for a supposed “discovery” recent. However, nonsense was released in 1907, and soon dismantled in 1911 by Jordan de Freitas. Judge Eduardo Ribeiro put more “points in the iis” in this regard. In your time I will publish the full documentation about the presence of Camões in Macao, putting a definitive end to the mythical “myth”. What life did Camões in Macau? We can say that these two years were those of the greatest professional, economic and affective in his life. Is it written poetry? Constantly, as the dimension of the work attests. A significant part of “the Lusíadas” was composed here, although the poem had neither began nor ended in Macao. Not least in his life was that it was in Macao who publicly assumed a relationship with a young Chinese, most exactly the Tanka ethnicity of poor fishermen. This asymmetrical connection is not surprising and with a modest young woman: only disadvantaged families would not prevent daughters from relate to foreigners. This explains the fact that she left with Camões in 1565 to Goa, with concubine status. But the private vessel in which they followed, belonging to Chinese merchants, suffered a wreck by Cambodia, and Camões lost there the “kind lamp I loved so much”. It was only after his death that he would come to chrisma as Denamene, a Greek nymph of the waters, so that she could live forever in the ocean. The Chinese of Macao have a special relationship with Camões, such as the Portuguese and the Macanese. How is this relationship? It existed in the eighteenth century in Macao the first monument in honor of Camões, something that in Portugal only began to think about the following century. He even received an inscription on Chinese, and even a Chinese pavilion was built on his sanctuary. The Viscount of Juromenha says that in 1845 the Viceroy of Canton and Imperial Commissioner Ki-A there was worshiped Camões as the “Portuguese Confucius”. And rightly, Camões shares many aspects of the sages of Chinese tradition: he established a dialogue with the masters through the recreation of larger works, cultivated a millennial tradition (he gloss two thousand years prior to his own time), practiced itinerary as a source of "sagesse", said the primacy of poetry, conceived the rivers as mythical entities, even personifying them, even personifying them, even He showed a marked tendency to moralize, and epitomously his thinking in masterful sentences. What connection did Camões have with Goa? Unlike Macao, Goa raised in Camões mostly negative feelings. The first impressions he had, like a lawless land in which only the little turns were worse, could not have been worse, as read in the initial letter to which he alluded: "long land, from all the poor honorable grave." In the second letter, he goes on, "I can say that it is the mother of bad villains, and stepmother of honorable men." These impressions would not improve over time, as corroborated the satire that led to the expulsion to Ternate in 1556. Goa, where he became the deputy protected, to fall later in the greatest disfavor under D. Antão de Noronha, was in his texts the inverted mirror of the Kingdom, the corrupt and corrupt Babylon, theil of God, and the betrayal of God, King and the law. In what is not original, as there are other sources that reinforce this Jeremiac and apocalyptic portrait of the capital of the Portuguese East Empire. Remember Bocage: "From the land to worst you are, O goa." This said, obviously that he will also have lived there sweethearts, especially under the viceroyalty of his protectors, and in living with some companions of the poetic lines that then lived there, and which he evokes in the so-called “feast of trovas”. To one of these cultured spirits, the poet Luís Franco, even a copy of his almost complete works, including the 'self of filodemo' that had composed there, that they could be saved if another adversity survived in the kingdom to the kingdom.
Do you think Portugal should pay more attention to your writings, streamlining your work more? How? In Lisbon it is necessary to build a great literary museum dedicated to Camões and its creations. The ideal place will be the Convent of St. Bento de Xabregas, where his friend Dom António had a grave at the Pantheon of the Line Chapel. Also in Goa the statue of Camões left for exile in the cruelly called “Archaeological Museum”, which is not the appropriate place to end the poetry or image of a poet. Being the greatest intangible heritage of Macao, Camões has been poorly used in this region. multimedia. What about Macau? Is Camões studied at higher education? Two students from the Macao University of Sciences and Technology will now defend their master's theses. The first is an in -depth technical study of the translation of Zhang Weim of the Camões Odes.
